3/*++
4/* NAME
5/* milter8 3
6/* SUMMARY
7/* MTA-side Sendmail 8 Milter protocol
8/* SYNOPSIS
9/* #include <milter8.h>
10/*
11/* MILTER *milter8_create(name, conn_timeout, cmd_timeout, msg_timeout,
12/* protocol, def_action, parent)
13/* const char *name;
14/* int conn_timeout;
15/* int cmd_timeout;
16/* int msg_timeout;
17/* const char *protocol;
18/* const char *def_action;
19/* MILTERS *parent;
20/*
21/* MILTER *milter8_receive(stream)
22/* VSTREAM *stream;
23/* DESCRIPTION
24/* This module implements the MTA side of the Sendmail 8 mail
25/* filter protocol.
26/*
27/* milter8_create() creates a MILTER data structure with virtual
28/* functions that implement a client for the Sendmail 8 Milter
29/* protocol. These virtual functions are then invoked via the
30/* milter(3) interface. The *timeout, protocol and def_action
31/* arguments come directly from milter_create(). The parent
32/* argument specifies a context for content editing.
33/*
34/* milter8_receive() receives a mail filter definition from the
35/* specified stream. The result is zero in case of success.
36/*
37/* Arguments:
38/* .IP name
39/* The Milter application endpoint, either inet:host:port or
40/* unix:/pathname.
41/* DIAGNOSTICS
42/* Panic: interface violation. Fatal errors: out of memory.
43/* CONFIGURATION PARAMETERS
44/* milter8_protocol, protocol version and extensions
45/* SEE ALSO
46/* milter(3) generic Milter interface
47/* LICENSE
48/* .ad
49/* .fi
50/* The Secure Mailer license must be distributed with this software.
51/* AUTHOR(S)
52/* Wietse Venema
53/* IBM T.J. Watson Research
54/* P.O. Box 704
55/* Yorktown Heights, NY 10598, USA
56/*--*/
57

104/* Application-specific. */
105
106 /*
107 * Use our own protocol definitions, so that Postfix can be built even when
108 * libmilter is not installed. This means that we must specify the libmilter
109 * protocol version in main.cf, and that we must send only the commands that
110 * are supported for that protocol version.
111 */
112
113 /*
114 * Commands from MTA to filter.
115 */
116#define SMFIC_ABORT 'A' /* Abort */
117#define SMFIC_BODY 'B' /* Body chunk */
118#define SMFIC_CONNECT 'C' /* Connection information */
119#define SMFIC_MACRO 'D' /* Define macro */
120#define SMFIC_BODYEOB 'E' /* final body chunk (End) */
121#define SMFIC_HELO 'H' /* HELO/EHLO */
122#define SMFIC_HEADER 'L' /* Header */
123#define SMFIC_MAIL 'M' /* MAIL from */
124#define SMFIC_EOH 'N' /* EOH */
125#define SMFIC_OPTNEG 'O' /* Option negotiation */
126#define SMFIC_QUIT 'Q' /* QUIT */
127#define SMFIC_RCPT 'R' /* RCPT to */
128#define SMFIC_DATA 'T' /* DATA */
129#define SMFIC_UNKNOWN 'U' /* Any unknown command */
130 /* Introduced with Sendmail 8.14. */
131#define SMFIC_QUIT_NC 'K' /* Quit + new connection */
132
133static const NAME_CODE smfic_table[] = {
134 "SMFIC_ABORT", SMFIC_ABORT,
135 "SMFIC_BODY", SMFIC_BODY,
136 "SMFIC_CONNECT", SMFIC_CONNECT,
137 "SMFIC_MACRO", SMFIC_MACRO,
138 "SMFIC_BODYEOB", SMFIC_BODYEOB,
139 "SMFIC_HELO", SMFIC_HELO,
140 "SMFIC_HEADER", SMFIC_HEADER,
141 "SMFIC_MAIL", SMFIC_MAIL,
142 "SMFIC_EOH", SMFIC_EOH,
143 "SMFIC_OPTNEG", SMFIC_OPTNEG,
144 "SMFIC_QUIT", SMFIC_QUIT,
145 "SMFIC_RCPT", SMFIC_RCPT,
146 "SMFIC_DATA", SMFIC_DATA,
147 "SMFIC_UNKNOWN", SMFIC_UNKNOWN,
148 /* Introduced with Sendmail 8.14. */
149 "SMFIC_QUIT_NC", SMFIC_QUIT_NC,
150 0, 0,
151};
152
153 /*
154 * Responses from filter to MTA.
155 */
156#define SMFIR_ADDRCPT '+' /* add recipient */
157#define SMFIR_DELRCPT '-' /* remove recipient */
158#define SMFIR_ACCEPT 'a' /* accept */
159#define SMFIR_REPLBODY 'b' /* replace body (chunk) */
160#define SMFIR_CONTINUE 'c' /* continue */
161#define SMFIR_DISCARD 'd' /* discard */
162#define SMFIR_CONN_FAIL 'f' /* cause a connection failure */
163#define SMFIR_CHGHEADER 'm' /* change header */
164#define SMFIR_PROGRESS 'p' /* progress */
165#define SMFIR_REJECT 'r' /* reject */
166#define SMFIR_TEMPFAIL 't' /* tempfail */
167#define SMFIR_SHUTDOWN '4' /* 421: shutdown (internal to MTA) */
168#define SMFIR_ADDHEADER 'h' /* add header */
169#define SMFIR_INSHEADER 'i' /* insert header */
170#define SMFIR_REPLYCODE 'y' /* reply code etc */
171#define SMFIR_QUARANTINE 'q' /* quarantine */
172 /* Introduced with Sendmail 8.14. */
173#define SMFIR_SKIP 's' /* skip further events of this type */
174#define SMFIR_CHGFROM 'e' /* change sender (incl. ESMTP args) */
175#define SMFIR_ADDRCPT_PAR '2' /* add recipient (incl. ESMTP args) */
176#define SMFIR_SETSYMLIST 'l' /* set list of symbols (macros) */
177
178static const NAME_CODE smfir_table[] = {
179 "SMFIR_ADDRCPT", SMFIR_ADDRCPT,
180 "SMFIR_DELRCPT", SMFIR_DELRCPT,
181 "SMFIR_ACCEPT", SMFIR_ACCEPT,
182 "SMFIR_REPLBODY", SMFIR_REPLBODY,
183 "SMFIR_CONTINUE", SMFIR_CONTINUE,
184 "SMFIR_DISCARD", SMFIR_DISCARD,
185 "SMFIR_CONN_FAIL", SMFIR_CONN_FAIL,
186 "SMFIR_CHGHEADER", SMFIR_CHGHEADER,
187 "SMFIR_PROGRESS", SMFIR_PROGRESS,
188 "SMFIR_REJECT", SMFIR_REJECT,
189 "SMFIR_TEMPFAIL", SMFIR_TEMPFAIL,
190 "SMFIR_SHUTDOWN", SMFIR_SHUTDOWN,
191 "SMFIR_ADDHEADER", SMFIR_ADDHEADER,
192 "SMFIR_INSHEADER", SMFIR_INSHEADER,
193 "SMFIR_REPLYCODE", SMFIR_REPLYCODE,
194 "SMFIR_QUARANTINE", SMFIR_QUARANTINE,
195 /* Introduced with Sendmail 8.14. */
196 "SMFIR_SKIP", SMFIR_SKIP,
197 "SMFIR_CHGFROM", SMFIR_CHGFROM,
198 "SMFIR_ADDRCPT_PAR", SMFIR_ADDRCPT_PAR,
199 "SMFIR_SETSYMLIST", SMFIR_SETSYMLIST,
200 0, 0,
201};
202
203 /*
204 * Commands that the filter does not want to receive, and replies that the
205 * filter will not send. Plus some other random stuff.
206 */
207#define SMFIP_NOCONNECT (1L<<0) /* filter does not want connect info */
208#define SMFIP_NOHELO (1L<<1) /* filter does not want HELO info */
209#define SMFIP_NOMAIL (1L<<2) /* filter does not want MAIL info */
210#define SMFIP_NORCPT (1L<<3) /* filter does not want RCPT info */
211#define SMFIP_NOBODY (1L<<4) /* filter does not want body */
212#define SMFIP_NOHDRS (1L<<5) /* filter does not want headers */
213#define SMFIP_NOEOH (1L<<6) /* filter does not want EOH */
214#define SMFIP_NR_HDR (1L<<7) /* filter won't reply for header */
215#define SMFIP_NOHREPL SMFIP_NR_HDR
216#define SMFIP_NOUNKNOWN (1L<<8) /* filter does not want unknown cmd */
217#define SMFIP_NODATA (1L<<9) /* filter does not want DATA */
218 /* Introduced with Sendmail 8.14. */
219#define SMFIP_SKIP (1L<<10)/* MTA supports SMFIR_SKIP */
220#define SMFIP_RCPT_REJ (1L<<11)/* filter wants rejected RCPTs */
221#define SMFIP_NR_CONN (1L<<12)/* filter won't reply for connect */
222#define SMFIP_NR_HELO (1L<<13)/* filter won't reply for HELO */
223#define SMFIP_NR_MAIL (1L<<14)/* filter won't reply for MAIL */
224#define SMFIP_NR_RCPT (1L<<15)/* filter won't reply for RCPT */
225#define SMFIP_NR_DATA (1L<<16)/* filter won't reply for DATA */
226#define SMFIP_NR_UNKN (1L<<17)/* filter won't reply for UNKNOWN */
227#define SMFIP_NR_EOH (1L<<18)/* filter won't reply for eoh */
228#define SMFIP_NR_BODY (1L<<19)/* filter won't reply for body chunk */
229#define SMFIP_HDR_LEADSPC (1L<<20)/* header value has leading space */
230
231#define SMFIP_NOSEND_MASK \
232 (SMFIP_NOCONNECT | SMFIP_NOHELO | SMFIP_NOMAIL | SMFIP_NORCPT \
233 | SMFIP_NOBODY | SMFIP_NOHDRS | SMFIP_NOEOH | SMFIP_NOUNKNOWN \
234 | SMFIP_NODATA)
235
236#define SMFIP_NOREPLY_MASK \
237 (SMFIP_NR_CONN | SMFIP_NR_HELO | SMFIP_NR_MAIL | SMFIP_NR_RCPT \
238 | SMFIP_NR_DATA | SMFIP_NR_UNKN | SMFIP_NR_HDR | SMFIP_NR_EOH | \
239 SMFIP_NR_BODY)
240
241static const NAME_MASK smfip_table[] = {
242 "SMFIP_NOCONNECT", SMFIP_NOCONNECT,
243 "SMFIP_NOHELO", SMFIP_NOHELO,
244 "SMFIP_NOMAIL", SMFIP_NOMAIL,
245 "SMFIP_NORCPT", SMFIP_NORCPT,
246 "SMFIP_NOBODY", SMFIP_NOBODY,
247 "SMFIP_NOHDRS", SMFIP_NOHDRS,
248 "SMFIP_NOEOH", SMFIP_NOEOH,
249 "SMFIP_NR_HDR", SMFIP_NR_HDR,
250 "SMFIP_NOUNKNOWN", SMFIP_NOUNKNOWN,
251 "SMFIP_NODATA", SMFIP_NODATA,
252 /* Introduced with Sendmail 8.14. */
253 "SMFIP_SKIP", SMFIP_SKIP,
254 "SMFIP_RCPT_REJ", SMFIP_RCPT_REJ,
255 "SMFIP_NR_CONN", SMFIP_NR_CONN,
256 "SMFIP_NR_HELO", SMFIP_NR_HELO,
257 "SMFIP_NR_MAIL", SMFIP_NR_MAIL,
258 "SMFIP_NR_RCPT", SMFIP_NR_RCPT,
259 "SMFIP_NR_DATA", SMFIP_NR_DATA,
260 "SMFIP_NR_UNKN", SMFIP_NR_UNKN,
261 "SMFIP_NR_EOH", SMFIP_NR_EOH,
262 "SMFIP_NR_BODY", SMFIP_NR_BODY,
263 "SMFIP_HDR_LEADSPC", SMFIP_HDR_LEADSPC,
264 0, 0,
265};
266
267 /*
268 * Options that the filter may send at initial handshake time, and message
269 * modifications that the filter may request at the end of the message body.
270 */
271#define SMFIF_ADDHDRS (1L<<0) /* filter may add headers */
272#define SMFIF_CHGBODY (1L<<1) /* filter may replace body */
273#define SMFIF_ADDRCPT (1L<<2) /* filter may add recipients */
274#define SMFIF_DELRCPT (1L<<3) /* filter may delete recipients */
275#define SMFIF_CHGHDRS (1L<<4) /* filter may change/delete headers */
276#define SMFIF_QUARANTINE (1L<<5) /* filter may quarantine envelope */
277 /* Introduced with Sendmail 8.14. */
278#define SMFIF_CHGFROM (1L<<6) /* filter may replace sender */
279#define SMFIF_ADDRCPT_PAR (1L<<7) /* filter may add recipients + args */
280#define SMFIF_SETSYMLIST (1L<<8) /* filter may send macro names */
281
282static const NAME_MASK smfif_table[] = {
283 "SMFIF_ADDHDRS", SMFIF_ADDHDRS,
284 "SMFIF_CHGBODY", SMFIF_CHGBODY,
285 "SMFIF_ADDRCPT", SMFIF_ADDRCPT,
286 "SMFIF_DELRCPT", SMFIF_DELRCPT,
287 "SMFIF_CHGHDRS", SMFIF_CHGHDRS,
288 "SMFIF_QUARANTINE", SMFIF_QUARANTINE,
289 /* Introduced with Sendmail 8.14. */
290 "SMFIF_CHGFROM", SMFIF_CHGFROM,
291 "SMFIF_ADDRCPT_PAR", SMFIF_ADDRCPT_PAR,
292 "SMFIF_SETSYMLIST", SMFIF_SETSYMLIST,
293 0, 0,
294};
295
296 /*
297 * Network protocol families, used when sending CONNECT information.
298 */
299#define SMFIA_UNKNOWN 'U' /* unknown */
300#define SMFIA_UNIX 'L' /* unix/local */
301#define SMFIA_INET '4' /* inet */
302#define SMFIA_INET6 '6' /* inet6 */
303
304 /*
305 * External macro class numbers, to identify the optional macro name lists
306 * that may be sent after the initial negotiation header.
307 */
308#define SMFIM_CONNECT 0 /* macros for connect */
309#define SMFIM_HELO 1 /* macros for HELO */
310#define SMFIM_ENVFROM 2 /* macros for MAIL */
311#define SMFIM_ENVRCPT 3 /* macros for RCPT */
312#define SMFIM_DATA 4 /* macros for DATA */
313#define SMFIM_EOM 5 /* macros for end-of-message */
314#define SMFIM_EOH 6 /* macros for end-of-header */
315
316static const NAME_CODE smfim_table[] = {
317 "SMFIM_CONNECT", SMFIM_CONNECT,
318 "SMFIM_HELO", SMFIM_HELO,
319 "SMFIM_ENVFROM", SMFIM_ENVFROM,
320 "SMFIM_ENVRCPT", SMFIM_ENVRCPT,
321 "SMFIM_DATA", SMFIM_DATA,
322 "SMFIM_EOM", SMFIM_EOM,
323 "SMFIM_EOH", SMFIM_EOH,
324 0, 0,
325};
326
327 /*
328 * Mapping from external macro class numbers to our internal MILTER_MACROS
329 * structure members, without using a switch statement.
330 */
331static const size_t milter8_macro_offsets[] = {
332 offsetof(MILTER_MACROS, conn_macros), /* SMFIM_CONNECT */
333 offsetof(MILTER_MACROS, helo_macros), /* SMFIM_HELO */
334 offsetof(MILTER_MACROS, mail_macros), /* SMFIM_ENVFROM */
335 offsetof(MILTER_MACROS, rcpt_macros), /* SMFIM_ENVRCPT */
336 offsetof(MILTER_MACROS, data_macros), /* SMFIM_DATA */
337 offsetof(MILTER_MACROS, eod_macros),/* Note: SMFIM_EOM < SMFIM_EOH */
338 offsetof(MILTER_MACROS, eoh_macros),/* Note: SMFIM_EOH > SMFIM_EOM */
339};
340
341#define MILTER8_MACRO_PTR(__macros, __class) \
342 ((char **) (((char *) (__macros)) + milter8_macro_offsets[(__class)]))
343
344 /*
345 * How much buffer space is available for sending body content.
346 */
347#define MILTER_CHUNK_SIZE 65535 /* body chunk size */
348
349/*#define msg_verbose 2*/
350
351 /*
352 * Sendmail 8 mail filter client.
353 */
354typedef struct {
355 MILTER m; /* parent class */
356 int conn_timeout; /* connect timeout */
357 int cmd_timeout; /* per-command timeout */
358 int msg_timeout; /* content inspection timeout */
359 char *protocol; /* protocol version/extension */
360 char *def_action; /* action if unavailable */
361 int version; /* application protocol version */
362 int rq_mask; /* application requests (SMFIF_*) */
363 int ev_mask; /* application events (SMFIP_*) */
364 int np_mask; /* events outside my protocol version */
365 VSTRING *buf; /* I/O buffer */
366 VSTRING *body; /* I/O buffer */
367 VSTREAM *fp; /* stream or null (closed) */
368
369 /*
370 * Following fields must be reset after successful CONNECT, to avoid
371 * leakage from one use to another.
372 */
373 int state; /* MILTER8_STAT_mumble */
374 char *def_reply; /* error response or null */
375 int skip_event_type; /* skip operations of this type */
376} MILTER8;
377
378 /*
379 * XXX Sendmail 8 libmilter automatically closes the MTA-to-filter socket
380 * when it finds out that the SMTP client has disconnected. Because of this
381 * behavior, Postfix has to open a new MTA-to-filter socket each time an
382 * SMTP client connects.
383 */
384#define LIBMILTER_AUTO_DISCONNECT
385
386 /*
387 * Milter internal state. For the external representation we use SMTP
388 * replies (4XX X.Y.Z text, 5XX X.Y.Z text) and one-letter strings
389 * (H=quarantine, D=discard, S=shutdown).
390 */
391#define MILTER8_STAT_ERROR 1 /* error, must be non-zero */
392#define MILTER8_STAT_CLOSED 2 /* no connection */
393#define MILTER8_STAT_READY 3 /* wait for connect event */
394#define MILTER8_STAT_ENVELOPE 4 /* in envelope */
395#define MILTER8_STAT_MESSAGE 5 /* in message */
396#define MILTER8_STAT_ACCEPT_CON 6 /* accept all commands */
397#define MILTER8_STAT_ACCEPT_MSG 7 /* accept one message */
398#define MILTER8_STAT_REJECT_CON 8 /* reject all commands */
399
400 /*
401 * Protocol formatting requests. Note: the terms "long" and "short" refer to
402 * the data types manipulated by htonl(), htons() and friends. These types
403 * are network specific, not host platform specific.
404 */
405#define MILTER8_DATA_END 0 /* no more arguments */
406#define MILTER8_DATA_HLONG 1 /* host long */
407#define MILTER8_DATA_BUFFER 2 /* network-formatted buffer */
408#define MILTER8_DATA_STRING 3 /* null-terminated string */
409#define MILTER8_DATA_NSHORT 4 /* network short */
410#define MILTER8_DATA_ARGV 5 /* array of null-terminated strings */
411#define MILTER8_DATA_OCTET 6 /* byte */
412#define MILTER8_DATA_MORE 7 /* more arguments in next call */
413
414 /*
415 * We don't accept insane amounts of data.
416 */
417#define XXX_MAX_DATA (INT_MAX / 2)
418#define XXX_TIMEOUT 10
419
420 /*
421 * We implement the protocol up to and including version 6, and configure in
422 * main.cf what protocol version we will use. The version is the first data
423 * item in the SMFIC_OPTNEG packet.
424 *
425 * We must send only events that are defined for the specified protocol
426 * version. Libmilter may disconnect when we send unexpected events.
427 *
428 * The following events are supported in all our milter protocol versions.
429 */
430#define MILTER8_V2_PROTO_MASK \
431 (SMFIP_NOCONNECT | SMFIP_NOHELO | SMFIP_NOMAIL | SMFIP_NORCPT | \
432 SMFIP_NOBODY | SMFIP_NOHDRS | SMFIP_NOEOH)
433
434 /*
435 * Events supported by later versions.
436 */
437#define MILTER8_V3_PROTO_MASK (MILTER8_V2_PROTO_MASK | SMFIP_NOUNKNOWN)
438#define MILTER8_V4_PROTO_MASK (MILTER8_V3_PROTO_MASK | SMFIP_NODATA)
439#define MILTER8_V6_PROTO_MASK \
440 (MILTER8_V4_PROTO_MASK | SMFIP_SKIP | SMFIP_RCPT_REJ \
441 | SMFIP_NOREPLY_MASK | SMFIP_HDR_LEADSPC)
442
443 /*
444 * What events we can send to the milter application. The milter8_protocol
445 * parameter can specify a protocol version as well as protocol extensions
446 * such as "no_header_reply", a feature that speeds up the protocol by not
447 * sending a filter reply for every individual message header.
448 *
449 * This looks unclean because the user can specify multiple protocol versions,
450 * but that is taken care of by the table that follows this one.
451 *
452 * XXX Is this still needed? Sendmail 8.14 provides a proper way to negotiate
453 * what replies the mail filter will send.
454 *
455 * XXX Keep this table in reverse numerical order. This is needed by the code
456 * that implements compatibility with older Milter protocol versions.
457 */
458static const NAME_CODE milter8_event_masks[] = {
459 "6", MILTER8_V6_PROTO_MASK,
460 "4", MILTER8_V4_PROTO_MASK,
461 "3", MILTER8_V3_PROTO_MASK,
462 "2", MILTER8_V2_PROTO_MASK,
463 "no_header_reply", SMFIP_NOHREPL,
464 0, -1,
465};
466
467 /*
468 * The following table lets us use the same milter8_protocol parameter
469 * setting to derive the protocol version number. In this case we ignore
470 * protocol extensions such as "no_header_reply", and require that exactly
471 * one version number is specified.
472 */
473static const NAME_CODE milter8_versions[] = {
474 "2", 2,
475 "3", 3,
476 "4", 4,
477 "6", 6,
478 "no_header_reply", 0,
479 0, -1,
480};
481
482/* SLMs. */
483
484#define STR(x) vstring_str(x)
485#define LEN(x) VSTRING_LEN(x)
486
487/* milter8_def_reply - set persistent response */
488
489static const char *milter8_def_reply(MILTER8 *milter, const char *reply)
490{
491 if (milter->def_reply)
492 myfree(milter->def_reply);
493 milter->def_reply = reply ? mystrdup(reply) : 0;
494 return (milter->def_reply);
495}
496
497/* milter8_conf_error - local/remote configuration error */
498
499static int milter8_conf_error(MILTER8 *milter)
500{
501 const char *reply;
502
503 /*
504 * XXX When the cleanup server closes its end of the Milter socket while
505 * editing a queue file, the SMTP server is left out of sync with the
506 * Milter. Sending an ABORT to the Milters will not restore
507 * synchronization, because there may be any number of Milter replies
508 * already in flight. Workaround: poison the socket and force the SMTP
509 * server to abandon it.
510 */
511 if (milter->fp != 0) {
512 (void) shutdown(vstream_fileno(milter->fp), SHUT_RDWR);
513 (void) vstream_fclose(milter->fp);
514 milter->fp = 0;
515 }
516 if (strcasecmp(milter->def_action, "accept") == 0) {
517 reply = 0;
518 } else if (strcasecmp(milter->def_action, "quarantine") == 0) {
519 reply = "H";
520 } else {
521 reply = "451 4.3.5 Server configuration problem - try again later";
522 }
523 milter8_def_reply(milter, reply);
524 return (milter->state = MILTER8_STAT_ERROR);
525}
526
527/* milter8_comm_error - read/write/format communication error */
528
529static int milter8_comm_error(MILTER8 *milter)
530{
531 const char *reply;
532
533 /*
534 * XXX When the cleanup server closes its end of the Milter socket while
535 * editing a queue file, the SMTP server is left out of sync with the
536 * Milter. Sending an ABORT to the Milters will not restore
537 * synchronization, because there may be any number of Milter replies
538 * already in flight. Workaround: poison the socket and force the SMTP
539 * server to abandon it.
540 */
541 if (milter->fp != 0) {
542 (void) shutdown(vstream_fileno(milter->fp), SHUT_RDWR);
543 (void) vstream_fclose(milter->fp);
544 milter->fp = 0;
545 }
546 if (strcasecmp(milter->def_action, "accept") == 0) {
547 reply = 0;
548 } else if (strcasecmp(milter->def_action, "reject") == 0) {
549 reply = "550 5.5.0 Service unavailable";
550 } else if (strcasecmp(milter->def_action, "tempfail") == 0) {
551 reply = "451 4.7.1 Service unavailable - try again later";
552 } else if (strcasecmp(milter->def_action, "quarantine") == 0) {
553 reply = "H";
554 } else {
555 msg_warn("milter %s: unrecognized default action: %s",
556 milter->m.name, milter->def_action);
557 reply = "451 4.3.5 Server configuration problem - try again later";
558 }
559 milter8_def_reply(milter, reply);
560 return (milter->state = MILTER8_STAT_ERROR);
561}
562
563/* milter8_close_stream - close stream to milter application */
564
565static void milter8_close_stream(MILTER8 *milter)
566{
567 if (milter->fp != 0) {
568 (void) vstream_fclose(milter->fp);
569 milter->fp = 0;
570 }
571 milter->state = MILTER8_STAT_CLOSED;
572}
573
574/* milter8_read_resp - receive command code now, receive data later */
575
576static int milter8_read_resp(MILTER8 *milter, int event, unsigned char *command,
577 ssize_t *data_len)
578{
579 UINT32_TYPE len;
580 ssize_t pkt_len;
581 const char *smfic_name;
582 int cmd;
583
584 /*
585 * Receive the packet length.
586 */
587 if ((vstream_fread(milter->fp, (void *) &len, UINT32_SIZE))
588 != UINT32_SIZE) {
589 smfic_name = str_name_code(smfic_table, event);
590 msg_warn("milter %s: can't read %s reply packet header: %m",
591 milter->m.name, smfic_name != 0 ?
592 smfic_name : "(unknown MTA event)");
593 return (milter8_comm_error(milter));
594 } else if ((pkt_len = ntohl(len)) < 1) {
595 msg_warn("milter %s: bad packet length: %ld",
596 milter->m.name, (long) pkt_len);
597 return (milter8_comm_error(milter));
598 } else if (pkt_len > XXX_MAX_DATA) {
599 msg_warn("milter %s: unreasonable packet length: %ld > %ld",
600 milter->m.name, (long) pkt_len, (long) XXX_MAX_DATA);
601 return (milter8_comm_error(milter));
602 }
603
604 /*
605 * Receive the command code.
606 */
607 else if ((cmd = VSTREAM_GETC(milter->fp)) == VSTREAM_EOF) {
608 msg_warn("milter %s: EOF while reading command code: %m",
609 milter->m.name);
610 return (milter8_comm_error(milter));
611 }
612
613 /*
614 * All is well.
615 */
616 else {
617 *command = cmd;
618 *data_len = pkt_len - 1;
619 return (0);
620 }
621}
622
623static int milter8_read_data(MILTER8 *milter, ssize_t *data_len,...);
624
625/* vmilter8_read_data - read command data */
626
627static int vmilter8_read_data(MILTER8 *milter, ssize_t *data_len, va_list ap)
628{
629 const char *myname = "milter8_read_data";
630 int arg_type;
631 UINT32_TYPE net_long;
632 UINT32_TYPE *host_long_ptr;
633 VSTRING *buf;
634 int ch;
635
636 while ((arg_type = va_arg(ap, int)) > 0 && arg_type != MILTER8_DATA_MORE) {
637 switch (arg_type) {
638
639 /*
640 * Host order long.
641 */
642 case MILTER8_DATA_HLONG:
643 if (*data_len < UINT32_SIZE) {
644 msg_warn("milter %s: input packet too short for network long",
645 milter->m.name);
646 return (milter8_comm_error(milter));
647 }
648 host_long_ptr = va_arg(ap, UINT32_TYPE *);
649 if (vstream_fread(milter->fp, (void *) &net_long, UINT32_SIZE)
650 != UINT32_SIZE) {
651 msg_warn("milter %s: EOF while reading network long: %m",
652 milter->m.name);
653 return (milter8_comm_error(milter));
654 }
655 *data_len -= UINT32_SIZE;
656 *host_long_ptr = ntohl(net_long);
657 break;
658
659 /*
660 * Raw on-the-wire format, without explicit null terminator.
661 */
662 case MILTER8_DATA_BUFFER:
663 if (*data_len < 0) {
664 msg_warn("milter %s: no data in input packet", milter->m.name);
665 return (milter8_comm_error(milter));
666 }
667 buf = va_arg(ap, VSTRING *);
668 VSTRING_RESET(buf);
669 VSTRING_SPACE(buf, *data_len);
670 if (vstream_fread(milter->fp, (void *) STR(buf), *data_len)
671 != *data_len) {
672 msg_warn("milter %s: EOF while reading data: %m", milter->m.name);
673 return (milter8_comm_error(milter));
674 }
675 VSTRING_AT_OFFSET(buf, *data_len);
676 *data_len = 0;
677 break;
678
679 /*
680 * Pointer to null-terminated string.
681 */
682 case MILTER8_DATA_STRING:
683 if (*data_len < 1) {
684 msg_warn("milter %s: packet too short for string",
685 milter->m.name);
686 return (milter8_comm_error(milter));
687 }
688 buf = va_arg(ap, VSTRING *);
689 VSTRING_RESET(buf);
690 for (;;) {
691 if ((ch = VSTREAM_GETC(milter->fp)) == VSTREAM_EOF) {
692 msg_warn("%s: milter %s: EOF while reading string: %m",
693 myname, milter->m.name);
694 return (milter8_comm_error(milter));
695 }
696 *data_len -= 1;
697 if (ch == 0)
698 break;
699 VSTRING_ADDCH(buf, ch);
700 if (*data_len <= 0) {
701 msg_warn("%s: milter %s: missing string null termimator",
702 myname, milter->m.name);
703 return (milter8_comm_error(milter));
704 }
705 }
706 VSTRING_TERMINATE(buf);
707 break;
708
709 /*
710 * Error.
711 */
712 default:
713 msg_panic("%s: unknown argument type: %d", myname, arg_type);
714 }
715 }
716
717 /*
718 * Sanity checks. We may have excess data when the sender is confused. We
719 * may have a negative count when we're confused ourselves.
720 */
721 if (arg_type != MILTER8_DATA_MORE && *data_len > 0) {
722 msg_warn("%s: left-over data %ld bytes", myname, (long) *data_len);
723 return (milter8_comm_error(milter));
724 }
725 if (*data_len < 0)
726 msg_panic("%s: bad left-over data count %ld",
727 myname, (long) *data_len);
728 return (0);
729}
730
731/* milter8_read_data - read command data */
732
733static int milter8_read_data(MILTER8 *milter, ssize_t *data_len,...)
734{
735 va_list ap;
736 int ret;
737
738 va_start(ap, data_len);
739 ret = vmilter8_read_data(milter, data_len, ap);
740 va_end(ap);
741 return (ret);
742}
743
744/* vmilter8_size_data - compute command data length */
745
746static ssize_t vmilter8_size_data(va_list ap)
747{
748 const char *myname = "vmilter8_size_data";
749 ssize_t data_len;
750 int arg_type;
751 VSTRING *buf;
752 const char *str;
753 const char **cpp;
754
755 /*
756 * Compute data size.
757 */
758 for (data_len = 0; (arg_type = va_arg(ap, int)) > 0; /* void */ ) {
759 switch (arg_type) {
760
761 /*
762 * Host order long.
763 */
764 case MILTER8_DATA_HLONG:
765 (void) va_arg(ap, UINT32_TYPE);
766 data_len += UINT32_SIZE;
767 break;
768
769 /*
770 * Raw on-the-wire format.
771 */
772 case MILTER8_DATA_BUFFER:
773 buf = va_arg(ap, VSTRING *);
774 data_len += LEN(buf);
775 break;
776
777 /*
778 * Pointer to null-terminated string.
779 */
780 case MILTER8_DATA_STRING:
781 str = va_arg(ap, char *);
782 data_len += strlen(str) + 1;
783 break;
784
785 /*
786 * Array of pointers to null-terminated strings.
787 */
788 case MILTER8_DATA_ARGV:
789 for (cpp = va_arg(ap, const char **); *cpp; cpp++)
790 data_len += strlen(*cpp) + 1;
791 break;
792
793 /*
794 * Network order short, promoted to int.
795 */
796 case MILTER8_DATA_NSHORT:
797 (void) va_arg(ap, unsigned);
798 data_len += UINT16_SIZE;
799 break;
800
801 /*
802 * Octet, promoted to int.
803 */
804 case MILTER8_DATA_OCTET:
805 (void) va_arg(ap, unsigned);
806 data_len += 1;
807 break;
808
809 /*
810 * Error.
811 */
812 default:
813 msg_panic("%s: bad argument type: %d", myname, arg_type);
814 }
815 }
816 va_end(ap);
817 return (data_len);
818}
819
820/* vmilter8_write_cmd - write command to Sendmail 8 Milter */
821
822static int vmilter8_write_cmd(MILTER8 *milter, int command, ssize_t data_len,
823 va_list ap)
824{
825 const char *myname = "vmilter8_write_cmd";
826 int arg_type;
827 UINT32_TYPE pkt_len;
828 UINT32_TYPE host_long;
829 UINT32_TYPE net_long;
830 UINT16_TYPE net_short;
831 VSTRING *buf;
832 const char *str;
833 const char **cpp;
834 char ch;
835
836 /*
837 * Deliver the packet.
838 */
839 if ((pkt_len = 1 + data_len) < 1)
840 msg_panic("%s: bad packet length %d", myname, pkt_len);
841 pkt_len = htonl(pkt_len);
842 (void) vstream_fwrite(milter->fp, (void *) &pkt_len, UINT32_SIZE);
843 (void) VSTREAM_PUTC(command, milter->fp);
844 while ((arg_type = va_arg(ap, int)) > 0) {
845 switch (arg_type) {
846
847 /*
848 * Network long.
849 */
850 case MILTER8_DATA_HLONG:
851 host_long = va_arg(ap, UINT32_TYPE);
852 net_long = htonl(host_long);
853 (void) vstream_fwrite(milter->fp, (void *) &net_long, UINT32_SIZE);
854 break;
855
856 /*
857 * Raw on-the-wire format.
858 */
859 case MILTER8_DATA_BUFFER:
860 buf = va_arg(ap, VSTRING *);
861 (void) vstream_fwrite(milter->fp, STR(buf), LEN(buf));
862 break;
863
864 /*
865 * Pointer to null-terminated string.
866 */
867 case MILTER8_DATA_STRING:
868 str = va_arg(ap, char *);
869 (void) vstream_fwrite(milter->fp, str, strlen(str) + 1);
870 break;
871
872 /*
873 * Octet, promoted to int.
874 */
875 case MILTER8_DATA_OCTET:
876 ch = va_arg(ap, unsigned);
877 (void) vstream_fwrite(milter->fp, &ch, 1);
878 break;
879
880 /*
881 * Array of pointers to null-terminated strings.
882 */
883 case MILTER8_DATA_ARGV:
884 for (cpp = va_arg(ap, const char **); *cpp; cpp++)
885 (void) vstream_fwrite(milter->fp, *cpp, strlen(*cpp) + 1);
886 break;
887
888 /*
889 * Network order short, promoted to int.
890 */
891 case MILTER8_DATA_NSHORT:
892 net_short = va_arg(ap, unsigned);
893 (void) vstream_fwrite(milter->fp, (void *) &net_short, UINT16_SIZE);
894 break;
895
896 /*
897 * Error.
898 */
899 default:
900 msg_panic("%s: bad argument type: %d", myname, arg_type);
901 }
902
903 /*
904 * Report errors immediately.
905 */
906 if (vstream_ferror(milter->fp)) {
907 msg_warn("milter %s: error writing command: %m", milter->m.name);
908 milter8_comm_error(milter);
909 break;
910 }
911 }
912 va_end(ap);
913 return (milter->state == MILTER8_STAT_ERROR);
914}
915
916/* milter8_write_cmd - write command to Sendmail 8 Milter */
917
918static int milter8_write_cmd(MILTER8 *milter, int command,...)
919{
920 va_list ap;
921 va_list ap2;
922 ssize_t data_len;
923 int err;
924
925 /*
926 * Initialize argument lists.
927 */
928 va_start(ap, command);
929 VA_COPY(ap2, ap);
930
931 /*
932 * Size the command data.
933 */
934 data_len = vmilter8_size_data(ap);
935 va_end(ap);
936
937 /*
938 * Send the command and data.
939 */
940 err = vmilter8_write_cmd(milter, command, data_len, ap2);
941 va_end(ap2);
942
943 return (err);
944}
945
946/* milter8_event - report event and receive reply */
947
948static const char *milter8_event(MILTER8 *milter, int event,
949 int skip_event_flag,
950 int skip_reply,
951 ARGV *macros,...)
952{
953 const char *myname = "milter8_event";
954 va_list ap;
955 va_list ap2;
956 ssize_t data_len;
957 int err;
958 unsigned char cmd;
959 ssize_t data_size;
960 const char *smfic_name;
961 const char *smfir_name;
962 MILTERS *parent = milter->m.parent;
963 UINT32_TYPE index;
964 const char *edit_resp = 0;
965 const char *retval = 0;
966 VSTRING *body_line_buf = 0;
967 int done = 0;
968 int body_edit_lockout = 0;
969
970#define DONT_SKIP_REPLY 0
971
972 /*
973 * Sanity check.
974 */
975 if (milter->fp == 0 || milter->def_reply != 0) {
976 msg_warn("%s: attempt to send event %s to milter %s after error",
977 myname,
978 (smfic_name = str_name_code(smfic_table, event)) != 0 ?
979 smfic_name : "(unknown MTA event)", milter->m.name);
980 return (milter->def_reply);
981 }
982
983 /*
984 * Skip this event if it doesn't exist in the protocol that I announced.
985 */
986 if ((skip_event_flag & milter->np_mask) != 0) {
987 if (msg_verbose)
988 msg_info("skipping non-protocol event %s for milter %s",
989 (smfic_name = str_name_code(smfic_table, event)) != 0 ?
990 smfic_name : "(unknown MTA event)", milter->m.name);
991 return (milter->def_reply);
992 }
993
994 /*
995 * Skip further events of this type if the filter told us so.
996 */
997 if (milter->skip_event_type != 0) {
998 if (event == milter->skip_event_type) {
999 if (msg_verbose)
1000 msg_info("skipping event %s after SMFIR_SKIP from milter %s",
1001 (smfic_name = str_name_code(smfic_table, event)) != 0 ?
1002 smfic_name : "(unknown MTA event)", milter->m.name);
1003 return (milter->def_reply);
1004 } else {
1005 milter->skip_event_type = 0;
1006 }
1007 }
1008
1009 /*
1010 * Send the macros for this event, even when we're not reporting the
1011 * event itself. This does not introduce a performance problem because
1012 * we're sending macros and event parameters in one VSTREAM transaction.
1013 *
1014 * XXX Is this still necessary?
1015 */
1016 if (msg_verbose) {
1017 VSTRING *buf = vstring_alloc(100);
1018
1019 if (macros) {
1020 if (macros->argc > 0) {
1021 char **cpp;
1022
1023 for (cpp = macros->argv; *cpp && cpp[1]; cpp += 2)
1024 vstring_sprintf_append(buf, " %s=%s", *cpp, cpp[1]);
1025 }
1026 }
1027 msg_info("event: %s; macros:%s",
1028 (smfic_name = str_name_code(smfic_table, event)) != 0 ?
1029 smfic_name : "(unknown MTA event)", *STR(buf) ?
1030 STR(buf) : " (none)");
1031 vstring_free(buf);
1032 }
1033 if (macros) {
1034 if (milter8_write_cmd(milter, SMFIC_MACRO,
1035 MILTER8_DATA_OCTET, event,
1036 MILTER8_DATA_ARGV, macros->argv,
1037 MILTER8_DATA_END) != 0)
1038 return (milter->def_reply);
1039 }
1040
1041 /*
1042 * Skip this event if the Milter told us not to send it.
1043 */
1044 if ((skip_event_flag & milter->ev_mask) != 0) {
1045 if (msg_verbose)
1046 msg_info("skipping event %s for milter %s",
1047 (smfic_name = str_name_code(smfic_table, event)) != 0 ?
1048 smfic_name : "(unknown MTA event)", milter->m.name);
1049 return (milter->def_reply);
1050 }
1051
1052 /*
1053 * Initialize argument lists.
1054 */
1055 va_start(ap, macros);
1056 VA_COPY(ap2, ap);
1057
1058 /*
1059 * Compute the command data size. This is necessary because the protocol
1060 * sends length before content.
1061 */
1062 data_len = vmilter8_size_data(ap);
1063 va_end(ap);
1064
1065 /*
1066 * Send the command and data.
1067 */
1068 err = vmilter8_write_cmd(milter, event, data_len, ap2);
1069 va_end(ap2);
1070
1071 /*
1072 * C99 requires that we finalize argument lists before returning.
1073 */
1074 if (err != 0)
1075 return (milter->def_reply);
1076
1077 /*
1078 * Special feature: don't wait for one reply per header. This allows us
1079 * to send multiple headers in one VSTREAM transaction, and improves
1080 * over-all performance.
1081 */
1082 if (skip_reply) {
1083 if (msg_verbose)
1084 msg_info("skipping reply for event %s from milter %s",
1085 (smfic_name = str_name_code(smfic_table, event)) != 0 ?
1086 smfic_name : "(unknown MTA event)", milter->m.name);
1087 return (milter->def_reply);
1088 }
1089
1090 /*
1091 * Receive the reply or replies.
1092 *
1093 * Intercept all loop exits so that we can do post header/body edit
1094 * processing.
1095 *
1096 * XXX Bound the loop iteration count.
1097 *
1098 * In the end-of-body stage, the Milter may reply with one or more queue
1099 * file edit requests before it replies with its final decision: accept,
1100 * reject, etc. After a local queue file edit error (file too big, media
1101 * write error), do not close the Milter socket in the cleanup server.
1102 * Instead skip all further Milter replies until the final decision. This
1103 * way the Postfix SMTP server stays in sync with the Milter, and Postfix
1104 * doesn't have to lose the ability to handle multiple deliveries within
1105 * the same SMTP session. This requires that the Postfix SMTP server uses
1106 * something other than CLEANUP_STAT_WRITE when it loses contact with the
1107 * cleanup server.
1108 */
1109#define IN_CONNECT_EVENT(e) ((e) == SMFIC_CONNECT || (e) == SMFIC_HELO)
1110
1111 /*
1112 * XXX Don't evaluate this macro's argument multiple times. Since we use
1113 * "continue" the macro can't be enclosed in do .. while (0).
1114 */
1115#define MILTER8_EVENT_BREAK(s) { \
1116 retval = (s); \
1117 done = 1; \
1118 continue; \
1119 }
1120
1121 while (done == 0) {
1122 char *cp;
1123 char *rp;
1124 char ch;
1125 char *next;
1126
1127 if (milter8_read_resp(milter, event, &cmd, &data_size) != 0)
1128 MILTER8_EVENT_BREAK(milter->def_reply);
1129 if (msg_verbose)
1130 msg_info("reply: %s data %ld bytes",
1131 (smfir_name = str_name_code(smfir_table, cmd)) != 0 ?
1132 smfir_name : "unknown", (long) data_size);
1133
1134 /*
1135 * Handle unfinished message body replacement first.
1136 *
1137 * XXX When SMFIR_REPLBODY is followed by some different request, we
1138 * assume that the body replacement operation is complete. The queue
1139 * file editing implementation currently does not support sending
1140 * part 1 of the body replacement text, doing some other queue file
1141 * updates, and then sending part 2 of the body replacement text. To
1142 * avoid loss of data, we log an error when SMFIR_REPLBODY requests
1143 * are alternated with other requests.
1144 */
1145 if (body_line_buf != 0 && cmd != SMFIR_REPLBODY) {
1146 /* In case the last body replacement line didn't end in CRLF. */
1147 if (edit_resp == 0 && LEN(body_line_buf) > 0)
1148 edit_resp = parent->repl_body(parent->chg_context,
1149 MILTER_BODY_LINE,
1150 body_line_buf);
1151 if (edit_resp == 0)
1152 edit_resp = parent->repl_body(parent->chg_context,
1153 MILTER_BODY_END,
1154 (VSTRING *) 0);
1155 body_edit_lockout = 1;
1156 vstring_free(body_line_buf);
1157 body_line_buf = 0;
1158 }
1159 switch (cmd) {
1160
1161 /*
1162 * Still working on it.
1163 */
1164 case SMFIR_PROGRESS:
1165 if (data_size != 0)
1166 break;
1167 continue;
1168
1169 /*
1170 * Decision: continue processing.
1171 */
1172 case SMFIR_CONTINUE:
1173 if (data_size != 0)
1174 break;
1175 MILTER8_EVENT_BREAK(milter->def_reply);
1176
1177 /*
1178 * Decision: accept this message, or accept all further commands
1179 * in this SMTP connection. This decision is final (i.e. Sendmail
1180 * 8 changes receiver state).
1181 */
1182 case SMFIR_ACCEPT:
1183 if (data_size != 0)
1184 break;
1185 if (IN_CONNECT_EVENT(event)) {
1186#ifdef LIBMILTER_AUTO_DISCONNECT
1187 milter8_close_stream(milter);
1188#endif
1189 /* No more events for this SMTP connection. */
1190 milter->state = MILTER8_STAT_ACCEPT_CON;
1191 } else {
1192 /* No more events for this message. */
1193 milter->state = MILTER8_STAT_ACCEPT_MSG;
1194 }
1195 MILTER8_EVENT_BREAK(milter->def_reply);
1196
1197 /*
1198 * Decision: accept and silently discard this message. According
1199 * to the milter API documentation there will be no action when
1200 * this is requested by a connection-level function. This
1201 * decision is final (i.e. Sendmail 8 changes receiver state).
1202 */
1203 case SMFIR_DISCARD:
1204 if (data_size != 0)
1205 break;
1206 if (IN_CONNECT_EVENT(event)) {
1207 msg_warn("milter %s: DISCARD action is not allowed "
1208 "for connect or helo", milter->m.name);
1209 MILTER8_EVENT_BREAK(milter->def_reply);
1210 } else {
1211 /* No more events for this message. */
1212 milter->state = MILTER8_STAT_ACCEPT_MSG;
1213 MILTER8_EVENT_BREAK("D");
1214 }
1215
1216 /*
1217 * Decision: reject connection, message or recipient. This
1218 * decision is final (i.e. Sendmail 8 changes receiver state).
1219 */
1220 case SMFIR_REJECT:
1221 if (data_size != 0)
1222 break;
1223 if (IN_CONNECT_EVENT(event)) {
1224#ifdef LIBMILTER_AUTO_DISCONNECT
1225 milter8_close_stream(milter);
1226#endif
1227 milter->state = MILTER8_STAT_REJECT_CON;
1228 MILTER8_EVENT_BREAK(milter8_def_reply(milter, "550 5.7.1 Command rejected"));
1229 } else {
1230 MILTER8_EVENT_BREAK("550 5.7.1 Command rejected");
1231 }
1232
1233 /*
1234 * Decision: tempfail. This decision is final (i.e. Sendmail 8
1235 * changes receiver state).
1236 */
1237 case SMFIR_TEMPFAIL:
1238 if (data_size != 0)
1239 break;
1240 if (IN_CONNECT_EVENT(event)) {
1241#ifdef LIBMILTER_AUTO_DISCONNECT
1242 milter8_close_stream(milter);
1243#endif
1244 milter->state = MILTER8_STAT_REJECT_CON;
1245 MILTER8_EVENT_BREAK(milter8_def_reply(milter,
1246 "451 4.7.1 Service unavailable - try again later"));
1247 } else {
1248 MILTER8_EVENT_BREAK("451 4.7.1 Service unavailable - try again later");
1249 }
1250
1251 /*
1252 * Decision: disconnect. This decision is final (i.e. Sendmail 8
1253 * changes receiver state).
1254 */
1255 case SMFIR_SHUTDOWN:
1256 if (data_size != 0)
1257 break;
1258#ifdef LIBMILTER_AUTO_DISCONNECT
1259 milter8_close_stream(milter);
1260#endif
1261 milter->state = MILTER8_STAT_REJECT_CON;
1262 MILTER8_EVENT_BREAK(milter8_def_reply(milter, "S"));
1263
1264 /*
1265 * Decision: "ddd d.d+.d+ text". This decision is final (i.e.
1266 * Sendmail 8 changes receiver state). Note: the reply may be in
1267 * multi-line SMTP format.
1268 *
1269 * XXX Sendmail compatibility: sendmail 8 uses the reply as a format
1270 * string; therefore any '%' characters in the reply are doubled.
1271 * Postfix doesn't use replies as format strings; we replace '%%'
1272 * by '%', and remove single (i.e. invalid) '%' characters.
1273 */
1274 case SMFIR_REPLYCODE:
1275 if (milter8_read_data(milter, &data_size,
1276 MILTER8_DATA_BUFFER, milter->buf,
1277 MILTER8_DATA_END) != 0)
1278 MILTER8_EVENT_BREAK(milter->def_reply);
1279 /* XXX Enforce this for each line of a multi-line reply. */
1280 if ((STR(milter->buf)[0] != '4' && STR(milter->buf)[0] != '5')
1281 || !ISDIGIT(STR(milter->buf)[1])
1282 || !ISDIGIT(STR(milter->buf)[2])
1283 || (STR(milter->buf)[3] != ' ' && STR(milter->buf)[3] != '-')
1284 || (ISDIGIT(STR(milter->buf)[4])
1285 && (STR(milter->buf)[4] != STR(milter->buf)[0]))) {
1286 msg_warn("milter %s: malformed reply: %s",
1287 milter->m.name, STR(milter->buf));
1288 milter8_conf_error(milter);
1289 MILTER8_EVENT_BREAK(milter->def_reply);
1290 }
1291 if ((rp = cp = strchr(STR(milter->buf), '%')) != 0) {
1292 for (;;) {
1293 if ((ch = *cp++) == '%')
1294 ch = *cp++;
1295 *rp++ = ch;
1296 if (ch == 0)
1297 break;
1298 }
1299 }
1300 if (var_soft_bounce) {
1301 for (cp = STR(milter->buf); /* void */ ; cp = next) {
1302 if (cp[0] == '5') {
1303 cp[0] = '4';
1304 if (cp[4] == '5')
1305 cp[4] = '4';
1306 }
1307 if ((next = strstr(cp, "\r\n")) == 0)
1308 break;
1309 next += 2;
1310 }
1311 }
1312 if (IN_CONNECT_EVENT(event)) {
1313#ifdef LIBMILTER_AUTO_DISCONNECT
1314 milter8_close_stream(milter);
1315#endif
1316 milter->state = MILTER8_STAT_REJECT_CON;
1317 MILTER8_EVENT_BREAK(milter8_def_reply(milter, STR(milter->buf)));
1318 } else {
1319 MILTER8_EVENT_BREAK(STR(milter->buf));
1320 }
1321
1322 /*
1323 * Decision: quarantine. In Sendmail 8.13 this does not imply a
1324 * transition in the receiver state (reply, reject, tempfail,
1325 * accept, discard). We should not transition, either, otherwise
1326 * we get out of sync.
1327 */
1328 case SMFIR_QUARANTINE:
1329 /* XXX What to do with the "reason" text? */
1330 if (milter8_read_data(milter, &data_size,
1331 MILTER8_DATA_BUFFER, milter->buf,
1332 MILTER8_DATA_END) != 0)
1333 MILTER8_EVENT_BREAK(milter->def_reply);
1334 milter8_def_reply(milter, "H");
1335 continue;
1336
1337 /*
1338 * Decision: skip further events of this type.
1339 */
1340 case SMFIR_SKIP:
1341 if (data_size != 0)
1342 break;
1343 milter->skip_event_type = event;
1344 MILTER8_EVENT_BREAK(milter->def_reply);
1345
1346 /*
1347 * Modification request or error.
1348 */
1349 default:
1350 if (event == SMFIC_BODYEOB) {
1351 switch (cmd) {
1352
1353#define MILTER8_HDR_SPACE(m) (((m)->ev_mask & SMFIP_HDR_LEADSPC) ? "" : " ")
1354
1355 /*
1356 * Modification request: replace, insert or delete
1357 * header. Index 1 means the first instance.
1358 */
1359 case SMFIR_CHGHEADER:
1360 if (milter8_read_data(milter, &data_size,
1361 MILTER8_DATA_HLONG, &index,
1362 MILTER8_DATA_STRING, milter->buf,
1363 MILTER8_DATA_STRING, milter->body,
1364 MILTER8_DATA_END) != 0)
1365 MILTER8_EVENT_BREAK(milter->def_reply);
1366 /* Skip to the next request after previous edit error. */
1367 if (edit_resp)
1368 continue;
1369 /* XXX Sendmail 8 compatibility. */
1370 if (index == 0)
1371 index = 1;
1372 if ((ssize_t) index < 1) {
1373 msg_warn("milter %s: bad change header index: %ld",
1374 milter->m.name, (long) index);
1375 milter8_conf_error(milter);
1376 MILTER8_EVENT_BREAK(milter->def_reply);
1377 }
1378 if (LEN(milter->buf) == 0) {
1379 msg_warn("milter %s: null change header name",
1380 milter->m.name);
1381 milter8_conf_error(milter);
1382 MILTER8_EVENT_BREAK(milter->def_reply);
1383 }
1384 if (STR(milter->body)[0])
1385 edit_resp = parent->upd_header(parent->chg_context,
1386 (ssize_t) index,
1387 STR(milter->buf),
1388 MILTER8_HDR_SPACE(milter),
1389 STR(milter->body));
1390 else
1391 edit_resp = parent->del_header(parent->chg_context,
1392 (ssize_t) index,
1393 STR(milter->buf));
1394 continue;
1395
1396 /*
1397 * Modification request: append header.
1398 */
1399 case SMFIR_ADDHEADER:
1400 if (milter8_read_data(milter, &data_size,
1401 MILTER8_DATA_STRING, milter->buf,
1402 MILTER8_DATA_STRING, milter->body,
1403 MILTER8_DATA_END) != 0)
1404 MILTER8_EVENT_BREAK(milter->def_reply);
1405 /* Skip to the next request after previous edit error. */
1406 if (edit_resp)
1407 continue;
1408 edit_resp = parent->add_header(parent->chg_context,
1409 STR(milter->buf),
1410 MILTER8_HDR_SPACE(milter),
1411 STR(milter->body));
1412 continue;
1413
1414 /*
1415 * Modification request: insert header. With Sendmail 8,
1416 * index 0 means the top-most header. We use 1-based
1417 * indexing for consistency with header change
1418 * operations.
1419 */
1420 case SMFIR_INSHEADER:
1421 if (milter8_read_data(milter, &data_size,
1422 MILTER8_DATA_HLONG, &index,
1423 MILTER8_DATA_STRING, milter->buf,
1424 MILTER8_DATA_STRING, milter->body,
1425 MILTER8_DATA_END) != 0)
1426 MILTER8_EVENT_BREAK(milter->def_reply);
1427 /* Skip to the next request after previous edit error. */
1428 if (edit_resp)
1429 continue;
1430 if ((ssize_t) index + 1 < 1) {
1431 msg_warn("milter %s: bad insert header index: %ld",
1432 milter->m.name, (long) index);
1433 milter8_conf_error(milter);
1434 MILTER8_EVENT_BREAK(milter->def_reply);
1435 }
1436 edit_resp = parent->ins_header(parent->chg_context,
1437 (ssize_t) index + 1,
1438 STR(milter->buf),
1439 MILTER8_HDR_SPACE(milter),
1440 STR(milter->body));
1441 continue;
1442
1443 /*
1444 * Modification request: replace sender, with optional
1445 * ESMTP args.
1446 */
1447 case SMFIR_CHGFROM:
1448 if (milter8_read_data(milter, &data_size,
1449 MILTER8_DATA_STRING, milter->buf,
1450 MILTER8_DATA_MORE) != 0)
1451 MILTER8_EVENT_BREAK(milter->def_reply);
1452 if (data_size > 0) {
1453 if (milter8_read_data(milter, &data_size,
1454 MILTER8_DATA_STRING, milter->body,
1455 MILTER8_DATA_END) != 0)
1456 MILTER8_EVENT_BREAK(milter->def_reply);
1457 } else {
1458 VSTRING_RESET(milter->body);
1459 VSTRING_TERMINATE(milter->body);
1460 }
1461 /* Skip to the next request after previous edit error. */
1462 if (edit_resp)
1463 continue;
1464 edit_resp = parent->chg_from(parent->chg_context,
1465 STR(milter->buf),
1466 STR(milter->body));
1467 continue;
1468
1469 /*
1470 * Modification request: append recipient.
1471 */
1472 case SMFIR_ADDRCPT:
1473 if (milter8_read_data(milter, &data_size,
1474 MILTER8_DATA_STRING, milter->buf,
1475 MILTER8_DATA_END) != 0)
1476 MILTER8_EVENT_BREAK(milter->def_reply);
1477 /* Skip to the next request after previous edit error. */
1478 if (edit_resp)
1479 continue;
1480 edit_resp = parent->add_rcpt(parent->chg_context,
1481 STR(milter->buf));
1482 continue;
1483
1484 /*
1485 * Modification request: append recipient, with optional
1486 * ESMTP args.
1487 */
1488 case SMFIR_ADDRCPT_PAR:
1489 if (milter8_read_data(milter, &data_size,
1490 MILTER8_DATA_STRING, milter->buf,
1491 MILTER8_DATA_MORE) != 0)
1492 MILTER8_EVENT_BREAK(milter->def_reply);
1493 if (data_size > 0) {
1494 if (milter8_read_data(milter, &data_size,
1495 MILTER8_DATA_STRING, milter->body,
1496 MILTER8_DATA_END) != 0)
1497 MILTER8_EVENT_BREAK(milter->def_reply);
1498 } else {
1499 VSTRING_RESET(milter->body);
1500 VSTRING_TERMINATE(milter->body);
1501 }
1502 /* Skip to the next request after previous edit error. */
1503 if (edit_resp)
1504 continue;
1505 edit_resp = parent->add_rcpt_par(parent->chg_context,
1506 STR(milter->buf),
1507 STR(milter->body));
1508 continue;
1509
1510 /*
1511 * Modification request: delete (expansion of) recipient.
1512 */
1513 case SMFIR_DELRCPT:
1514 if (milter8_read_data(milter, &data_size,
1515 MILTER8_DATA_STRING, milter->buf,
1516 MILTER8_DATA_END) != 0)
1517 MILTER8_EVENT_BREAK(milter->def_reply);
1518 /* Skip to the next request after previous edit error. */
1519 if (edit_resp)
1520 continue;
1521 edit_resp = parent->del_rcpt(parent->chg_context,
1522 STR(milter->buf));
1523 continue;
1524
1525 /*
1526 * Modification request: replace the message body, and
1527 * update the message size.
1528 */
1529 case SMFIR_REPLBODY:
1530 if (body_edit_lockout) {
1531 msg_warn("milter %s: body replacement requests can't "
1532 "currently be mixed with other requests",
1533 milter->m.name);
1534 milter8_conf_error(milter);
1535 MILTER8_EVENT_BREAK(milter->def_reply);
1536 }
1537 if (milter8_read_data(milter, &data_size,
1538 MILTER8_DATA_BUFFER, milter->body,
1539 MILTER8_DATA_END) != 0)
1540 MILTER8_EVENT_BREAK(milter->def_reply);
1541 /* Skip to the next request after previous edit error. */
1542 if (edit_resp)
1543 continue;
1544 /* Start body replacement. */
1545 if (body_line_buf == 0) {
1546 body_line_buf = vstring_alloc(var_line_limit);
1547 edit_resp = parent->repl_body(parent->chg_context,
1548 MILTER_BODY_START,
1549 (VSTRING *) 0);
1550 }
1551 /* Extract lines from the on-the-wire CRLF format. */
1552 for (cp = STR(milter->body); edit_resp == 0
1553 && cp < vstring_end(milter->body); cp++) {
1554 ch = *(unsigned char *) cp;
1555 if (ch == '\n') {
1556 if (LEN(body_line_buf) > 0
1557 && vstring_end(body_line_buf)[-1] == '\r')
1558 vstring_truncate(body_line_buf,
1559 LEN(body_line_buf) - 1);
1560 edit_resp = parent->repl_body(parent->chg_context,
1561 MILTER_BODY_LINE,
1562 body_line_buf);
1563 VSTRING_RESET(body_line_buf);
1564 } else {
1565 VSTRING_ADDCH(body_line_buf, ch);
1566 }
1567 }
1568 continue;
1569 }
1570 }
1571 msg_warn("milter %s: unexpected filter response %s after event %s",
1572 milter->m.name,
1573 (smfir_name = str_name_code(smfir_table, cmd)) != 0 ?
1574 smfir_name : "(unknown filter reply)",
1575 (smfic_name = str_name_code(smfic_table, event)) != 0 ?
1576 smfic_name : "(unknown MTA event)");
1577 milter8_comm_error(milter);
1578 MILTER8_EVENT_BREAK(milter->def_reply);
1579 }
1580
1581 /*
1582 * Get here when the reply was followed by data bytes that weren't
1583 * supposed to be there.
1584 */
1585 msg_warn("milter %s: reply %s was followed by %ld data bytes",
1586 milter->m.name, (smfir_name = str_name_code(smfir_table, cmd)) != 0 ?
1587 smfir_name : "unknown", (long) data_len);
1588 milter8_comm_error(milter);
1589 MILTER8_EVENT_BREAK(milter->def_reply);
1590 }
1591
1592 /*
1593 * Clean up after aborted message body replacement.
1594 */
1595 if (body_line_buf)
1596 vstring_free(body_line_buf);
1597
1598 /*
1599 * XXX Some cleanup clients ask the cleanup server to bounce mail for
1600 * them. In that case we must override a hard reject retval result after
1601 * queue file update failure. This is not a big problem; the odds are
1602 * small that a Milter application sends a hard reject after replacing
1603 * the message body.
1604 */
1605 if (edit_resp && (retval == 0 || strchr("DS4", retval[0]) == 0))
1606 retval = edit_resp;
1607 return (retval);
1608}
1609
1610/* milter8_connect - connect to filter */
1611
1612static void milter8_connect(MILTER8 *milter)
1613{
1614 const char *myname = "milter8_connect";
1615 ssize_t data_len;
1616 unsigned char cmd;
1617 char *transport;
1618 char *endpoint;
1619 int (*connect_fn) (const char *, int, int);
1620 int fd;
1621 const UINT32_TYPE my_actions = (SMFIF_ADDHDRS | SMFIF_ADDRCPT
1622 | SMFIF_DELRCPT | SMFIF_CHGHDRS
1623 | SMFIF_CHGBODY
1624 | SMFIF_QUARANTINE
1625 | SMFIF_CHGFROM
1626 | SMFIF_ADDRCPT_PAR
1627 | SMFIF_SETSYMLIST
1628 );
1629 UINT32_TYPE my_version = 0;
1630 UINT32_TYPE my_events = 0;
1631 char *saved_version;
1632 char *cp;
1633 char *name;
1634
1635 /*
1636 * Sanity check.
1637 */
1638 if (milter->fp != 0)
1639 msg_panic("%s: milter %s: socket is not closed",
1640 myname, milter->m.name);
1641
1642 /*
1643 * For user friendliness reasons the milter_protocol configuration
1644 * parameter can specify both the protocol version and protocol
1645 * extensions (e.g., don't reply for each individual message header).
1646 *
1647 * The protocol version is sent as is to the milter application.
1648 *
1649 * The version and extensions determine what events we can send to the
1650 * milter application.
1651 *
1652 * We don't announce support for events that aren't defined for my protocol
1653 * version. Today's libmilter implementations don't seem to care, but we
1654 * don't want to take the risk that a future version will be more picky.
1655 */
1656 cp = saved_version = mystrdup(milter->protocol);
1657 while ((name = mystrtok(&cp, CHARS_COMMA_SP)) != 0) {
1658 int mask;
1659 int vers;
1660
1661 if ((mask = name_code(milter8_event_masks,
1662 NAME_CODE_FLAG_NONE, name)) == -1
1663 || (vers = name_code(milter8_versions,
1664 NAME_CODE_FLAG_NONE, name)) == -1
1665 || (vers != 0 && my_version != 0)) {
1666 msg_warn("milter %s: bad protocol information: %s",
1667 milter->m.name, name);
1668 milter8_conf_error(milter);
1669 return;
1670 }
1671 if (vers != 0)
1672 my_version = vers;
1673 my_events |= mask;
1674 }
1675 myfree(saved_version);
1676 if (my_events == 0 || my_version == 0) {
1677 msg_warn("milter %s: no protocol version information", milter->m.name);
1678 milter8_conf_error(milter);
1679 return;
1680 }
1681
1682 /*
1683 * Don't send events that aren't defined for my protocol version.
1684 */
1685 milter->np_mask = (SMFIP_NOSEND_MASK & ~my_events);
1686 if (msg_verbose)
1687 msg_info("%s: non-protocol events for protocol version %d: %s",
1688 myname, my_version,
1689 str_name_mask_opt(milter->buf, "non-protocol event mask",
1690 smfip_table, milter->np_mask, NAME_MASK_NUMBER));
1691
1692 /*
1693 * Parse the Milter application endpoint.
1694 */
1695#define FREE_TRANSPORT_AND_BAIL_OUT(milter, milter_error) do { \
1696 myfree(transport); \
1697 milter_error(milter); \
1698 return; \
1699 } while (0);
1700
1701 transport = mystrdup(milter->m.name);
1702 if ((endpoint = split_at(transport, ':')) == 0
1703 || *endpoint == 0 || *transport == 0) {
1704 msg_warn("Milter service needs transport:endpoint instead of \"%s\"",
1705 milter->m.name);
1706 FREE_TRANSPORT_AND_BAIL_OUT(milter, milter8_conf_error);
1707 }
1708 if (msg_verbose)
1709 msg_info("%s: transport=%s endpoint=%s", myname, transport, endpoint);
1710 if (strcmp(transport, "inet") == 0) {
1711 connect_fn = inet_connect;
1712 } else if (strcmp(transport, "unix") == 0) {
1713 connect_fn = unix_connect;
1714 } else if (strcmp(transport, "local") == 0) {
1715 connect_fn = LOCAL_CONNECT;
1716 } else {
1717 msg_warn("invalid transport name: %s in Milter service: %s",
1718 transport, milter->m.name);
1719 FREE_TRANSPORT_AND_BAIL_OUT(milter, milter8_conf_error);
1720 }
1721
1722 /*
1723 * Connect to the Milter application.
1724 */
1725 if ((fd = connect_fn(endpoint, BLOCKING, milter->conn_timeout)) < 0) {
1726 msg_warn("connect to Milter service %s: %m", milter->m.name);
1727 FREE_TRANSPORT_AND_BAIL_OUT(milter, milter8_comm_error);
1728 }
1729 myfree(transport);
1730 milter->fp = vstream_fdopen(fd, O_RDWR);
1731 vstream_control(milter->fp,
1732 CA_VSTREAM_CTL_DOUBLE,
1733 CA_VSTREAM_CTL_TIMEOUT(milter->cmd_timeout),
1734 CA_VSTREAM_CTL_END);
1735 /* Avoid poor performance when TCP MSS > VSTREAM_BUFSIZE. */
1736 if (connect_fn == inet_connect)
1737 vstream_tweak_tcp(milter->fp);
1738
1739 /*
1740 * Open the negotiations by sending what actions the Milter may request
1741 * and what events the Milter can receive.
1742 */
1743 if (msg_verbose) {
1744 msg_info("%s: my_version=0x%lx", myname, (long) my_version);
1745 msg_info("%s: my_actions=0x%lx %s", myname, (long) my_actions,
1746 str_name_mask_opt(milter->buf, "request mask",
1747 smfif_table, my_actions, NAME_MASK_NUMBER));
1748 msg_info("%s: my_events=0x%lx %s", myname, (long) my_events,
1749 str_name_mask_opt(milter->buf, "event mask",
1750 smfip_table, my_events, NAME_MASK_NUMBER));
1751 }
1752 errno = 0;
1753 if (milter8_write_cmd(milter, SMFIC_OPTNEG,
1754 MILTER8_DATA_HLONG, my_version,
1755 MILTER8_DATA_HLONG, my_actions,
1756 MILTER8_DATA_HLONG, my_events,
1757 MILTER8_DATA_END) != 0) {
1758 msg_warn("milter %s: write error in initial handshake",
1759 milter->m.name);
1760 /* milter8_write_cmd() called milter8_comm_error() */
1761 return;
1762 }
1763
1764 /*
1765 * Receive the filter's response and verify that we are compatible.
1766 */
1767 if (milter8_read_resp(milter, SMFIC_OPTNEG, &cmd, &data_len) != 0) {
1768 msg_warn("milter %s: read error in initial handshake", milter->m.name);
1769 /* milter8_read_resp() called milter8_comm_error() */
1770 return;
1771 }
1772 if (cmd != SMFIC_OPTNEG) {
1773 msg_warn("milter %s: unexpected reply \"%c\" in initial handshake",
1774 milter->m.name, cmd);
1775 (void) milter8_comm_error(milter);
1776 return;
1777 }
1778 if (milter8_read_data(milter, &data_len,
1779 MILTER8_DATA_HLONG, &milter->version,
1780 MILTER8_DATA_HLONG, &milter->rq_mask,
1781 MILTER8_DATA_HLONG, &milter->ev_mask,
1782 MILTER8_DATA_MORE) != 0) {
1783 msg_warn("milter %s: read error in initial handshake", milter->m.name);
1784 /* milter8_read_data() called milter8_comm_error() */
1785 return;
1786 }
1787 if (milter->version > my_version) {
1788 msg_warn("milter %s: protocol version %d conflict"
1789 " with MTA protocol version %d",
1790 milter->m.name, milter->version, my_version);
1791 (void) milter8_comm_error(milter);
1792 return;
1793 }
1794 if ((milter->rq_mask & my_actions) != milter->rq_mask) {
1795 msg_warn("milter %s: request mask 0x%x conflict"
1796 " with MTA request mask 0x%lx",
1797 milter->m.name, milter->rq_mask, (long) my_actions);
1798 (void) milter8_comm_error(milter);
1799 return;
1800 }
1801 if (milter->ev_mask & SMFIP_RCPT_REJ)
1802 milter->m.flags |= MILTER_FLAG_WANT_RCPT_REJ;
1803
1804 /*
1805 * Allow the remote application to run an older protocol version, but
1806 * don't them send events that their protocol version doesn't support.
1807 * Based on a suggestion by Kouhei Sutou.
1808 *
1809 * XXX When the Milter sends a protocol version that we don't have
1810 * information for, use the information for the next-lower protocol
1811 * version instead. This code assumes that the milter8_event_masks table
1812 * is organized in reverse numerical order.
1813 */
1814 if (milter->version < my_version) {
1815 const NAME_CODE *np;
1816 int version;
1817
1818 for (np = milter8_event_masks; /* see below */ ; np++) {
1819 if (np->name == 0) {
1820 msg_warn("milter %s: unexpected protocol version %d",
1821 milter->m.name, milter->version);
1822 break;
1823 }
1824 if ((version = atoi(np->name)) > 0 && version <= milter->version) {
1825 milter->np_mask |= (SMFIP_NOSEND_MASK & ~np->code);
1826 if (msg_verbose)
1827 msg_info("%s: non-protocol events for milter %s"
1828 " protocol version %d: %s",
1829 myname, milter->m.name, milter->version,
1830 str_name_mask_opt(milter->buf,
1831 "non-protocol event mask",
1832 smfip_table, milter->np_mask,
1833 NAME_MASK_NUMBER));
1834 break;
1835 }
1836 }
1837 }
1838
1839 /*
1840 * Initial negotiations completed.
1841 */
1842 if (msg_verbose) {
1843 if ((milter->ev_mask & my_events) != milter->ev_mask)
1844 msg_info("milter %s: event mask 0x%x includes features not"
1845 " offered in MTA event mask 0x%lx",
1846 milter->m.name, milter->ev_mask, (long) my_events);
1847 msg_info("%s: milter %s version %d",
1848 myname, milter->m.name, milter->version);
1849 msg_info("%s: events %s", myname,
1850 str_name_mask_opt(milter->buf, "event mask",
1851 smfip_table, milter->ev_mask, NAME_MASK_NUMBER));
1852 msg_info("%s: requests %s", myname,
1853 str_name_mask_opt(milter->buf, "request mask",
1854 smfif_table, milter->rq_mask, NAME_MASK_NUMBER));
1855 }
1856 milter->state = MILTER8_STAT_READY;
1857 milter8_def_reply(milter, 0);
1858 milter->skip_event_type = 0;
1859
1860 /*
1861 * Secondary negotiations: override lists of macro names.
1862 */
1863 if (data_len > 0) {
1864 VSTRING *buf = vstring_alloc(100);
1865 UINT32_TYPE mac_type;
1866 const char *smfim_name;
1867 char **mac_value_ptr;
1868
1869 milter->m.macros = milter_macros_alloc(MILTER_MACROS_ALLOC_EMPTY);
1870
1871 while (data_len > 0
1872 && milter8_read_data(milter, &data_len,
1873 MILTER8_DATA_HLONG, &mac_type,
1874 MILTER8_DATA_STRING, buf,
1875 MILTER8_DATA_MORE) == 0) {
1876 smfim_name = str_name_code(smfim_table, mac_type);
1877 if (smfim_name == 0) {
1878 msg_warn("milter %s: ignoring unknown macro type %u",
1879 milter->m.name, (unsigned) mac_type);
1880 } else {
1881 if (msg_verbose)
1882 msg_info("override %s macro list with \"%s\"",
1883 smfim_name, STR(buf));
1884 mac_value_ptr = MILTER8_MACRO_PTR(milter->m.macros, mac_type);
1885 myfree(*mac_value_ptr);
1886 *mac_value_ptr = mystrdup(STR(buf));
1887 }
1888 }
1889 /* milter8_read_data() calls milter8_comm_error() after error. */
1890 vstring_free(buf);
1891 /* At this point the filter state is either READY or ERROR. */
1892 }
1893}
1894
1895/* milter8_conn_event - report connect event to Sendmail 8 milter */
1896
1897static const char *milter8_conn_event(MILTER *m,
1898 const char *client_name,
1899 const char *client_addr,
1900 const char *client_port,
1901 unsigned addr_family,
1902 ARGV *macros)
1903{
1904 const char *myname = "milter8_conn_event";
1905 MILTER8 *milter = (MILTER8 *) m;
1906 int port;
1907 int skip_reply;
1908 const char *sm_name;
1909 char *ptr = 0;
1910 const char *resp;
1911
1912 /*
1913 * Need a global definition for "unknown" host name or address that is
1914 * shared by smtpd, cleanup and libmilter.
1915 */
1916#define XXX_UNKNOWN "unknown"
1917#define STR_EQ(x,y) (strcmp((x), (y)) == 0)
1918#define STR_NE(x,y) (strcmp((x), (y)) != 0)
1919
1920 /*
1921 * XXX Sendmail 8 libmilter closes the MTA-to-filter socket when it finds
1922 * out that the SMTP client has disconnected. Because of this, Postfix
1923 * has to open a new MTA-to-filter socket for each SMTP client.
1924 */
1925#ifdef LIBMILTER_AUTO_DISCONNECT
1926 milter8_connect(milter);
1927#endif
1928
1929 /*
1930 * Report the event.
1931 */
1932 switch (milter->state) {
1933 case MILTER8_STAT_ERROR:
1934 if (msg_verbose)
1935 msg_info("%s: skip milter %s", myname, milter->m.name);
1936 return (milter->def_reply);
1937 case MILTER8_STAT_READY:
1938 if (msg_verbose)
1939 msg_info("%s: milter %s: connect %s/%s",
1940 myname, milter->m.name, client_name, client_addr);
1941 if (client_port == 0) {
1942 port = 0;
1943 } else if (!alldig(client_port) || (port = atoi(client_port)) < 0
1944 || port > 65535) {
1945 msg_warn("milter %s: bad client port number %s",
1946 milter->m.name, client_port);
1947 port = 0;
1948 }
1949 milter->state = MILTER8_STAT_ENVELOPE;
1950 skip_reply = ((milter->ev_mask & SMFIP_NR_CONN) != 0);
1951 /* Transform unknown hostname from Postfix to Sendmail form. */
1952 sm_name = (STR_NE(client_name, XXX_UNKNOWN) ? client_name :
1953 STR_EQ(client_addr, XXX_UNKNOWN) ? client_name :
1954 (ptr = concatenate("[", client_addr, "]", (char *) 0)));
1955 switch (addr_family) {
1956 case AF_INET:
1957 resp = milter8_event(milter, SMFIC_CONNECT, SMFIP_NOCONNECT,
1958 skip_reply, macros,
1959 MILTER8_DATA_STRING, sm_name,
1960 MILTER8_DATA_OCTET, SMFIA_INET,
1961 MILTER8_DATA_NSHORT, htons(port),
1962 MILTER8_DATA_STRING, client_addr,
1963 MILTER8_DATA_END);
1964 break;
1965#ifdef HAS_IPV6
1966 case AF_INET6:
1967 resp = milter8_event(milter, SMFIC_CONNECT, SMFIP_NOCONNECT,
1968 skip_reply, macros,
1969 MILTER8_DATA_STRING, sm_name,
1970 MILTER8_DATA_OCTET, SMFIA_INET6,
1971 MILTER8_DATA_NSHORT, htons(port),
1972 MILTER8_DATA_STRING, client_addr,
1973 MILTER8_DATA_END);
1974 break;
1975#endif
1976 case AF_UNIX:
1977 resp = milter8_event(milter, SMFIC_CONNECT, SMFIP_NOCONNECT,
1978 skip_reply, macros,
1979 MILTER8_DATA_STRING, sm_name,
1980 MILTER8_DATA_OCTET, SMFIA_UNIX,
1981 MILTER8_DATA_NSHORT, htons(0),
1982 MILTER8_DATA_STRING, client_addr,
1983 MILTER8_DATA_END);
1984 break;
1985 default:
1986 resp = milter8_event(milter, SMFIC_CONNECT, SMFIP_NOCONNECT,
1987 skip_reply, macros,
1988 MILTER8_DATA_STRING, sm_name,
1989 MILTER8_DATA_OCTET, SMFIA_UNKNOWN,
1990 MILTER8_DATA_END);
1991 break;
1992 }
1993 if (ptr != 0)
1994 myfree(ptr);
1995 return (resp);
1996 default:
1997 msg_panic("%s: milter %s: bad state %d",
1998 myname, milter->m.name, milter->state);
1999 }
2000}
2001
2002/* milter8_helo_event - report HELO/EHLO command to Sendmail 8 milter */
2003
2004static const char *milter8_helo_event(MILTER *m, const char *helo_name,
2005 int unused_esmtp,
2006 ARGV *macros)
2007{
2008 const char *myname = "milter8_helo_event";
2009 MILTER8 *milter = (MILTER8 *) m;
2010 int skip_reply;
2011
2012 /*
2013 * Report the event.
2014 */
2015 switch (milter->state) {
2016 case MILTER8_STAT_ERROR:
2017 case MILTER8_STAT_ACCEPT_CON:
2018 case MILTER8_STAT_REJECT_CON:
2019 if (msg_verbose)
2020 msg_info("%s: skip milter %s", myname, milter->m.name);
2021 return (milter->def_reply);
2022 case MILTER8_STAT_ENVELOPE:
2023 case MILTER8_STAT_ACCEPT_MSG:
2024 /* With HELO after MAIL, smtpd(8) calls milter8_abort() next. */
2025 if (msg_verbose)
2026 msg_info("%s: milter %s: helo %s",
2027 myname, milter->m.name, helo_name);
2028 skip_reply = ((milter->ev_mask & SMFIP_NR_HELO) != 0);
2029 return (milter8_event(milter, SMFIC_HELO, SMFIP_NOHELO,
2030 skip_reply, macros,
2031 MILTER8_DATA_STRING, helo_name,
2032 MILTER8_DATA_END));
2033 default:
2034 msg_panic("%s: milter %s: bad state %d",
2035 myname, milter->m.name, milter->state);
2036 }
2037}
2038
2039/* milter8_mail_event - report MAIL command to Sendmail 8 milter */
2040
2041static const char *milter8_mail_event(MILTER *m, const char **argv,
2042 ARGV *macros)
2043{
2044 const char *myname = "milter8_mail_event";
2045 MILTER8 *milter = (MILTER8 *) m;
2046 const char **cpp;
2047 int skip_reply;
2048
2049 /*
2050 * Report the event.
2051 */
2052 switch (milter->state) {
2053 case MILTER8_STAT_ERROR:
2054 case MILTER8_STAT_ACCEPT_CON:
2055 case MILTER8_STAT_REJECT_CON:
2056 if (msg_verbose)
2057 msg_info("%s: skip milter %s", myname, milter->m.name);
2058 return (milter->def_reply);
2059 case MILTER8_STAT_ENVELOPE:
2060 if (msg_verbose) {
2061 VSTRING *buf = vstring_alloc(100);
2062
2063 for (cpp = argv; *cpp; cpp++)
2064 vstring_sprintf_append(buf, " %s", *cpp);
2065 msg_info("%s: milter %s: mail%s",
2066 myname, milter->m.name, STR(buf));
2067 vstring_free(buf);
2068 }
2069 skip_reply = ((milter->ev_mask & SMFIP_NR_MAIL) != 0);
2070 return (milter8_event(milter, SMFIC_MAIL, SMFIP_NOMAIL,
2071 skip_reply, macros,
2072 MILTER8_DATA_ARGV, argv,
2073 MILTER8_DATA_END));
2074 default:
2075 msg_panic("%s: milter %s: bad state %d",
2076 myname, milter->m.name, milter->state);
2077 }
2078}
2079
2080/* milter8_rcpt_event - report RCPT command to Sendmail 8 milter */
2081
2082static const char *milter8_rcpt_event(MILTER *m, const char **argv,
2083 ARGV *macros)
2084{
2085 const char *myname = "milter8_rcpt_event";
2086 MILTER8 *milter = (MILTER8 *) m;
2087 const char **cpp;
2088 int skip_reply;
2089
2090 /*
2091 * Report the event.
2092 */
2093 switch (milter->state) {
2094 case MILTER8_STAT_ERROR:
2095 case MILTER8_STAT_ACCEPT_CON:
2096 case MILTER8_STAT_REJECT_CON:
2097 case MILTER8_STAT_ACCEPT_MSG:
2098 if (msg_verbose)
2099 msg_info("%s: skip milter %s", myname, milter->m.name);
2100 return (milter->def_reply);
2101 case MILTER8_STAT_ENVELOPE:
2102 if (msg_verbose) {
2103 VSTRING *buf = vstring_alloc(100);
2104
2105 for (cpp = argv; *cpp; cpp++)
2106 vstring_sprintf_append(buf, " %s", *cpp);
2107 msg_info("%s: milter %s: rcpt%s",
2108 myname, milter->m.name, STR(buf));
2109 vstring_free(buf);
2110 }
2111 skip_reply = ((milter->ev_mask & SMFIP_NR_RCPT) != 0);
2112 return (milter8_event(milter, SMFIC_RCPT, SMFIP_NORCPT,
2113 skip_reply, macros,
2114 MILTER8_DATA_ARGV, argv,
2115 MILTER8_DATA_END));
2116 default:
2117 msg_panic("%s: milter %s: bad state %d",
2118 myname, milter->m.name, milter->state);
2119 }
2120}

2125{

2128 int skip_reply;
2129
2130 /*
2131 * Report the event.
2132 */
2133 switch (milter->state) {
2134 case MILTER8_STAT_ERROR:
2135 case MILTER8_STAT_ACCEPT_CON:
2136 case MILTER8_STAT_REJECT_CON:
2137 case MILTER8_STAT_ACCEPT_MSG:
2138 if (msg_verbose)
2139 msg_info("%s: skip milter %s", myname, milter->m.name);
2140 return (milter->def_reply);
2141 case MILTER8_STAT_ENVELOPE:
2142 if (msg_verbose)
2143 msg_info("%s: milter %s: data command", myname, milter->m.name);

2154/* milter8_unknown_event - report unknown SMTP command to Sendmail 8 milter */
2155
2156static const char *milter8_unknown_event(MILTER *m, const char *command,
2157 ARGV *macros)
2158{
2159 const char *myname = "milter8_unknown_event";
2160 MILTER8 *milter = (MILTER8 *) m;
2161 int skip_reply;
2162
2163 /*
2164 * Report the event.
2165 */
2166 switch (milter->state) {
2167 case MILTER8_STAT_ERROR:
2168 case MILTER8_STAT_ACCEPT_CON:
2169 case MILTER8_STAT_REJECT_CON:
2170 case MILTER8_STAT_ACCEPT_MSG:
2171 if (msg_verbose)
2172 msg_info("%s: skip milter %s", myname, milter->m.name);
2173 return (milter->def_reply);
2174 case MILTER8_STAT_ENVELOPE:
2175 if (msg_verbose)
2176 msg_info("%s: milter %s: unknown command: %s",
2177 myname, milter->m.name, command);
2178 /* XXX Sendmail doesn't send macros (checked with 8.6.13). */
2179 skip_reply = ((milter->ev_mask & SMFIP_NR_UNKN) != 0);
2180 return (milter8_event(milter, SMFIC_UNKNOWN, SMFIP_NOUNKNOWN,
2181 skip_reply, macros,
2182 MILTER8_DATA_STRING, command,
2183 MILTER8_DATA_END));
2184 default:
2185 msg_panic("%s: milter %s: bad state %d",
2186 myname, milter->m.name, milter->state);
2187 }
2188}
