2196
2197 /*
2198 * Return the default reply.
2199 */
2200 if (msg_verbose)
2201 msg_info("%s: milter %s", myname, milter->m.name);
2202 return (milter->def_reply);
2203}
2204
2205/* milter8_abort - cancel one milter's message receiving state */
2206
2207static void milter8_abort(MILTER *m)
2208{
2209 const char *myname = "milter8_abort";
2210 MILTER8 *milter = (MILTER8 *) m;
2211
2212 /*
2213 * XXX Sendmail 8 libmilter closes the MTA-to-filter socket when it finds
2214 * out that the SMTP client has disconnected. Because of this, Postfix
2215 * has to open a new MTA-to-filter socket for each SMTP client.
2216 */
2217 switch (milter->state) {
2218 case MILTER8_STAT_CLOSED:
2219 case MILTER8_STAT_READY:
2220 return;
2221 case MILTER8_STAT_ERROR:
2222 case MILTER8_STAT_ACCEPT_CON:
2223 case MILTER8_STAT_REJECT_CON:
2224 if (msg_verbose)
2225 msg_info("%s: skip milter %s", myname, milter->m.name);
2226 break;
2227 case MILTER8_STAT_ENVELOPE:
2228 case MILTER8_STAT_MESSAGE:
2229 case MILTER8_STAT_ACCEPT_MSG:
2230 if (msg_verbose)
2231 msg_info("%s: abort milter %s", myname, milter->m.name);
2232 (void) milter8_write_cmd(milter, SMFIC_ABORT, MILTER8_DATA_END);
2233 if (milter->state != MILTER8_STAT_ERROR)
2234 milter->state = MILTER8_STAT_ENVELOPE;
2235 break;
2236 default:
2237 msg_panic("%s: milter %s: bad state %d",
2238 myname, milter->m.name, milter->state);
2239 }
2240}
2241
2242/* milter8_disc_event - report client disconnect event */
2243
2244static void milter8_disc_event(MILTER *m)
2245{
2246 const char *myname = "milter8_disc_event";
2247 MILTER8 *milter = (MILTER8 *) m;
2248
2249 /*
2250 * XXX Sendmail 8 libmilter closes the MTA-to-filter socket when it finds
2251 * out that the SMTP client has disconnected. Because of this, Postfix
2252 * has to open a new MTA-to-filter socket for each SMTP client.
2253 */
2254 switch (milter->state) {
2255 case MILTER8_STAT_CLOSED:
2256 case MILTER8_STAT_READY:
2257 return;
2258 case MILTER8_STAT_ERROR:
2259#ifdef LIBMILTER_AUTO_DISCONNECT
2260 case MILTER8_STAT_ACCEPT_CON:
2261 case MILTER8_STAT_REJECT_CON:
2262#endif
2263 if (msg_verbose)
2264 msg_info("%s: skip quit milter %s", myname, milter->m.name);
2265 break;
2266 case MILTER8_STAT_ENVELOPE:
2267 case MILTER8_STAT_MESSAGE:
2268#ifndef LIBMILTER_AUTO_DISCONNECT
2269 case MILTER8_STAT_ACCEPT_CON:
2270 case MILTER8_STAT_REJECT_CON:
2271#endif
2272 case MILTER8_STAT_ACCEPT_MSG:
2273 if (msg_verbose)
2274 msg_info("%s: quit milter %s", myname, milter->m.name);
2275 (void) milter8_write_cmd(milter, SMFIC_QUIT, MILTER8_DATA_END);
2276 break;
2277 }
2278#ifdef LIBMILTER_AUTO_DISCONNECT
2279 milter8_close_stream(milter);
2280#else
2281 if (milter->state != MILTER8_STAT_ERROR)
2282 milter->state = MILTER8_STAT_READY;
2283#endif
2284 milter8_def_reply(milter, 0);
2285}
2286
2287 /*
2288 * Structure to ship context across the MIME_STATE engine.
2289 */
2290typedef struct {
2291 MILTER8 *milter; /* milter client */
2292 ARGV *eoh_macros; /* end-of-header macros */
2293 ARGV *eod_macros; /* end-of-body macros */
2294 ARGV *auto_hdrs; /* auto-generated headers */
2295 int auto_done; /* good enough for now */
2296 int first_header; /* first header */
2297 int first_body; /* first body line */
2298 const char *resp; /* milter application response */
2299} MILTER_MSG_CONTEXT;
2300
2301/* milter8_header - milter8_message call-back for message header */
2302
2303static void milter8_header(void *ptr, int unused_header_class,
2304 const HEADER_OPTS *header_info,
2305 VSTRING *buf, off_t unused_offset)
2306{
2307 const char *myname = "milter8_header";
2308 MILTER_MSG_CONTEXT *msg_ctx = (MILTER_MSG_CONTEXT *) ptr;
2309 MILTER8 *milter = msg_ctx->milter;
2310 char *cp;
2311 int skip_reply;
2312 char **cpp;
2313 unsigned done;
2314
2315 /*
2316 * XXX Workaround: mime_state_update() may invoke multiple call-backs
2317 * before returning to the caller.
2318 */
2319#define MILTER8_MESSAGE_DONE(milter, msg_ctx) \
2320 ((milter)->state != MILTER8_STAT_MESSAGE || (msg_ctx)->resp != 0)
2321
2322 if (MILTER8_MESSAGE_DONE(milter, msg_ctx))
2323 return;
2324
2325 /*
2326 * XXX Sendmail compatibility. Don't expose our first (received) header
2327 * to mail filter applications. See also cleanup_milter.c for code to
2328 * ensure that header replace requests are relative to the message
2329 * content as received, that is, without our own first (received) header,
2330 * while header insert requests are relative to the message as delivered,
2331 * that is, including our own first (received) header.
2332 *
2333 * XXX But this breaks when they delete our own Received: header with
2334 * header_checks before it reaches the queue file. Even then we must not
2335 * expose the first header to mail filter applications, otherwise the
2336 * dk-filter signature will be inserted at the wrong position. It should
2337 * precede the headers that it signs.
2338 *
2339 * XXX Sendmail compatibility. It eats the first space (not tab) after the
2340 * header label and ":".
2341 */
2342 for (cpp = msg_ctx->auto_hdrs->argv, done = 1; *cpp; cpp++, done <<= 1)
2343 if ((msg_ctx->auto_done & done) == 0 && strcmp(*cpp, STR(buf)) == 0) {
2344 msg_ctx->auto_done |= done;
2345 return;
2346 }
2347
2348 /*
2349 * Sendmail 8 sends multi-line headers as text separated by newline.
2350 *
2351 * We destroy the header buffer to split it into label and value. Changing
2352 * the buffer is explicitly allowed by the mime_state(3) interface.
2353 */
2354 if (msg_verbose > 1)
2355 msg_info("%s: header milter %s: %.100s",
2356 myname, milter->m.name, STR(buf));
2357 cp = STR(buf) + (header_info ? strlen(header_info->name) :
2358 is_header(STR(buf)));
2359 /* XXX Following matches is_header.c */
2360 while (*cp == ' ' || *cp == '\t')
2361 *cp++ = 0;
2362 if (*cp != ':')
2363 msg_panic("%s: header label not followed by ':'", myname);
2364 *cp++ = 0;
2365 /* XXX Sendmail by default eats one space (not tab) after the colon. */
2366 if ((milter->ev_mask & SMFIP_HDR_LEADSPC) == 0 && *cp == ' ')
2367 cp++;
2368 skip_reply = ((milter->ev_mask & SMFIP_NOHREPL) != 0);
2369 msg_ctx->resp =
2370 milter8_event(milter, SMFIC_HEADER, SMFIP_NOHDRS,
2371 skip_reply, msg_ctx->eoh_macros,
2372 MILTER8_DATA_STRING, STR(buf),
2373 MILTER8_DATA_STRING, cp,
2374 MILTER8_DATA_END);
2375}
2376
2377/* milter8_eoh - milter8_message call-back for end-of-header */
2378
2379static void milter8_eoh(void *ptr)
2380{
2381 const char *myname = "milter8_eoh";
2382 MILTER_MSG_CONTEXT *msg_ctx = (MILTER_MSG_CONTEXT *) ptr;
2383 MILTER8 *milter = msg_ctx->milter;
2384 int skip_reply;
2385
2386 if (MILTER8_MESSAGE_DONE(milter, msg_ctx))
2387 return;
2388 if (msg_verbose)
2389 msg_info("%s: eoh milter %s", myname, milter->m.name);
2390 skip_reply = ((milter->ev_mask & SMFIP_NR_EOH) != 0);
2391 msg_ctx->resp =
2392 milter8_event(milter, SMFIC_EOH, SMFIP_NOEOH,
2393 skip_reply, msg_ctx->eoh_macros,
2394 MILTER8_DATA_END);
2395}
2396
2397/* milter8_body - milter8_message call-back for body content */
2398
2399static void milter8_body(void *ptr, int rec_type,
2400 const char *buf, ssize_t len,
2401 off_t offset)
2402{
2403 const char *myname = "milter8_body";
2404 MILTER_MSG_CONTEXT *msg_ctx = (MILTER_MSG_CONTEXT *) ptr;
2405 MILTER8 *milter = msg_ctx->milter;
2406 ssize_t todo = len;
2407 const char *bp = buf;
2408 ssize_t space;
2409 ssize_t count;
2410 int skip_reply;
2411
2412 if (MILTER8_MESSAGE_DONE(milter, msg_ctx))
2413 return;
2414
2415 /*
2416 * XXX Sendmail compatibility: don't expose our first body line.
2417 */
2418 if (msg_ctx->first_body) {
2419 msg_ctx->first_body = 0;
2420 return;
2421 }
2422
2423 /*
2424 * XXX I thought I was going to delegate all the on-the-wire formatting
2425 * to a common lower layer, but unfortunately it's not practical. If we
2426 * were to do MILTER_CHUNK_SIZE buffering in a common lower layer, then
2427 * we would have to pass along call-backs and state, so that the
2428 * call-back can invoke milter8_event() with the right arguments when the
2429 * MILTER_CHUNK_SIZE buffer reaches capacity. That's just too ugly.
2430 *
2431 * To recover the cost of making an extra copy of body content from Milter
2432 * buffer to VSTREAM buffer, we could make vstream_fwrite() a little
2433 * smarter so that it does large transfers directly from the user buffer
2434 * instead of copying the data one block at a time into a VSTREAM buffer.
2435 */
2436 if (msg_verbose > 1)
2437 msg_info("%s: body milter %s: %.100s", myname, milter->m.name, buf);
2438 skip_reply = ((milter->ev_mask & SMFIP_NR_BODY) != 0);
2439 /* To append \r\n, simply redirect input to another buffer. */
2440 if (rec_type == REC_TYPE_NORM && todo == 0) {
2441 bp = "\r\n";
2442 todo = 2;
2443 rec_type = REC_TYPE_EOF;
2444 }
2445 while (todo > 0) {
2446 /* Append one REC_TYPE_NORM or REC_TYPE_CONT to body chunk buffer. */
2447 space = MILTER_CHUNK_SIZE - LEN(milter->body);
2448 if (space <= 0)
2449 msg_panic("%s: bad buffer size: %ld",
2450 myname, (long) LEN(milter->body));
2451 count = (todo > space ? space : todo);
2452 vstring_memcat(milter->body, bp, count);
2453 bp += count;
2454 todo -= count;
2455 /* Flush body chunk buffer when full. See also milter8_eob(). */
2456 if (LEN(milter->body) == MILTER_CHUNK_SIZE) {
2457 msg_ctx->resp =
2458 milter8_event(milter, SMFIC_BODY, SMFIP_NOBODY,
2459 skip_reply, msg_ctx->eod_macros,
2460 MILTER8_DATA_BUFFER, milter->body,
2461 MILTER8_DATA_END);
2462 if (MILTER8_MESSAGE_DONE(milter, msg_ctx))
2463 break;
2464 VSTRING_RESET(milter->body);
2465 }
2466 /* To append \r\n, simply redirect input to another buffer. */
2467 if (rec_type == REC_TYPE_NORM && todo == 0) {
2468 bp = "\r\n";
2469 todo = 2;
2470 rec_type = REC_TYPE_EOF;
2471 }
2472 }
2473}
2474
2475/* milter8_eob - milter8_message call-back for end-of-body */
2476
2477static void milter8_eob(void *ptr)
2478{
2479 const char *myname = "milter8_eob";
2480 MILTER_MSG_CONTEXT *msg_ctx = (MILTER_MSG_CONTEXT *) ptr;
2481 MILTER8 *milter = msg_ctx->milter;
2482 int skip_reply;
2483
2484 if (MILTER8_MESSAGE_DONE(milter, msg_ctx))
2485 return;
2486 if (msg_verbose)
2487 msg_info("%s: eob milter %s", myname, milter->m.name);
2488
2489 /*
2490 * Flush partial body chunk buffer. See also milter8_body().
2491 *
2492 * XXX Sendmail 8 libmilter accepts SMFIC_EOB+data, and delivers it to the
2493 * application as two events: SMFIC_BODY+data followed by SMFIC_EOB. This
2494 * breaks with the PMilter 0.95 protocol re-implementation, which
2495 * delivers the SMFIC_EOB event and ignores the data. To avoid such
2496 * compatibility problems we separate the events in the client. With
2497 * this, we also prepare for a future where different event types can
2498 * have different macro lists.
2499 */
2500 if (LEN(milter->body) > 0) {
2501 skip_reply = ((milter->ev_mask & SMFIP_NR_BODY) != 0);
2502 msg_ctx->resp =
2503 milter8_event(milter, SMFIC_BODY, SMFIP_NOBODY,
2504 skip_reply, msg_ctx->eod_macros,
2505 MILTER8_DATA_BUFFER, milter->body,
2506 MILTER8_DATA_END);
2507 if (MILTER8_MESSAGE_DONE(milter, msg_ctx))
2508 return;
2509 }
2510 msg_ctx->resp =
2511 milter8_event(msg_ctx->milter, SMFIC_BODYEOB, 0,
2512 DONT_SKIP_REPLY, msg_ctx->eod_macros,
2513 MILTER8_DATA_END);
2514}
2515
2516/* milter8_message - send message content and receive reply */
2517
2518static const char *milter8_message(MILTER *m, VSTREAM *qfile,
2519 off_t data_offset,
2520 ARGV *eoh_macros,
2521 ARGV *eod_macros,
2522 ARGV *auto_hdrs)
2523{
2524 const char *myname = "milter8_message";
2525 MILTER8 *milter = (MILTER8 *) m;
2526 MIME_STATE *mime_state;
2527 int rec_type;
2528 const MIME_STATE_DETAIL *detail;
2529 int mime_errs = 0;
2530 MILTER_MSG_CONTEXT msg_ctx;
2531 VSTRING *buf;
2532 int saved_errno;
2533
2534 switch (milter->state) {
2535 case MILTER8_STAT_ERROR:
2536 case MILTER8_STAT_ACCEPT_CON:
2537 case MILTER8_STAT_REJECT_CON:
2538 case MILTER8_STAT_ACCEPT_MSG:
2539 if (msg_verbose)
2540 msg_info("%s: skip message to milter %s", myname, milter->m.name);
2541 return (milter->def_reply);
2542 case MILTER8_STAT_ENVELOPE:
2543 if (msg_verbose)
2544 msg_info("%s: message to milter %s", myname, milter->m.name);
2545 if (vstream_fseek(qfile, data_offset, SEEK_SET) < 0) {
2546 saved_errno = errno;
2547 msg_warn("%s: vstream_fseek %s: %m", myname, VSTREAM_PATH(qfile));
2548 /* XXX This should be available from cleanup_strerror.c. */
2549 return (saved_errno == EFBIG ?
2550 "552 5.3.4 Message file too big" :
2551 "451 4.3.0 Queue file write error");
2552 }
2553 msg_ctx.milter = milter;
2554 msg_ctx.eoh_macros = eoh_macros;
2555 msg_ctx.eod_macros = eod_macros;
2556 msg_ctx.auto_hdrs = auto_hdrs;
2557 msg_ctx.auto_done = 0;
2558 msg_ctx.first_header = 1;
2559 msg_ctx.first_body = 1;
2560 msg_ctx.resp = 0;
2561 mime_state =
2562 mime_state_alloc(MIME_OPT_DISABLE_MIME,
2563 (milter->ev_mask & SMFIP_NOHDRS) ?
2564 (MIME_STATE_HEAD_OUT) 0 : milter8_header,
2565 (milter->ev_mask & SMFIP_NOEOH) ?
2566 (MIME_STATE_ANY_END) 0 : milter8_eoh,
2567 (milter->ev_mask & SMFIP_NOBODY) ?
2568 (MIME_STATE_BODY_OUT) 0 : milter8_body,
2569 milter8_eob,
2570 (MIME_STATE_ERR_PRINT) 0,
2571 (void *) &msg_ctx);
2572 buf = vstring_alloc(100);
2573 milter->state = MILTER8_STAT_MESSAGE;
2574 VSTRING_RESET(milter->body);
2575 vstream_control(milter->fp,
2576 CA_VSTREAM_CTL_DOUBLE,
2577 CA_VSTREAM_CTL_TIMEOUT(milter->msg_timeout),
2578 CA_VSTREAM_CTL_END);
2579
2580 /*
2581 * XXX When the message (not MIME body part) does not end in CRLF
2582 * (i.e. the last record was REC_TYPE_CONT), do we send a CRLF
2583 * terminator before triggering the end-of-body condition?
2584 */
2585 for (;;) {
2586 if ((rec_type = rec_get(qfile, buf, 0)) < 0) {
2587 msg_warn("%s: error reading %s: %m",
2588 myname, VSTREAM_PATH(qfile));
2589 msg_ctx.resp = "450 4.3.0 Queue file write error";
2590 break;
2591 }
2592 /* Invoke the appropriate call-back routine. */
2593 mime_errs = mime_state_update(mime_state, rec_type,
2594 STR(buf), LEN(buf));
2595 if (mime_errs) {
2596 detail = mime_state_detail(mime_errs);
2597 msg_warn("%s: MIME problem %s in %s",
2598 myname, detail->text, VSTREAM_PATH(qfile));
2599 msg_ctx.resp = "450 4.3.0 Queue file write error";
2600 break;
2601 }
2602 if (MILTER8_MESSAGE_DONE(milter, &msg_ctx))
2603 break;
2604 if (rec_type != REC_TYPE_NORM && rec_type != REC_TYPE_CONT)
2605 break;
2606 }
2607 mime_state_free(mime_state);
2608 vstring_free(buf);
2609 if (milter->fp)
2610 vstream_control(milter->fp,
2611 CA_VSTREAM_CTL_DOUBLE,
2612 CA_VSTREAM_CTL_TIMEOUT(milter->cmd_timeout),
2613 CA_VSTREAM_CTL_END);
2614 if (milter->state == MILTER8_STAT_MESSAGE
2615 || milter->state == MILTER8_STAT_ACCEPT_MSG)
2616 milter->state = MILTER8_STAT_ENVELOPE;
2617 return (msg_ctx.resp);
2618 default:
2619 msg_panic("%s: milter %s: bad state %d",
2620 myname, milter->m.name, milter->state);
2621 }
2622}
2623
2624 /*
2625 * Preliminary protocol to send/receive milter instances. This needs to be
2626 * extended with type information once we support multiple milter protocols.
2627 */
2628#define MAIL_ATTR_MILT_NAME "milter_name"
2629#define MAIL_ATTR_MILT_VERS "milter_version"
2630#define MAIL_ATTR_MILT_ACTS "milter_actions"
2631#define MAIL_ATTR_MILT_EVTS "milter_events"
2632#define MAIL_ATTR_MILT_NPTS "milter_non_events"
2633#define MAIL_ATTR_MILT_STAT "milter_state"
2634#define MAIL_ATTR_MILT_CONN "milter_conn_timeout"
2635#define MAIL_ATTR_MILT_CMD "milter_cmd_timeout"
2636#define MAIL_ATTR_MILT_MSG "milter_msg_timeout"
2637#define MAIL_ATTR_MILT_ACT "milter_action"
2638#define MAIL_ATTR_MILT_MAC "milter_macro_list"
2639
2640/* milter8_active - report if this milter still wants events */
2641
2642static int milter8_active(MILTER *m)
2643{
2644 MILTER8 *milter = (MILTER8 *) m;
2645
2646 return (milter->fp != 0
2647 && (milter->state == MILTER8_STAT_ENVELOPE
2648 || milter->state == MILTER8_STAT_READY));
2649}
2650
2651/* milter8_send - send milter instance */
2652
2653static int milter8_send(MILTER *m, VSTREAM *stream)
2654{
2655 const char *myname = "milter8_send";
2656 MILTER8 *milter = (MILTER8 *) m;
2657
2658 if (msg_verbose)
2659 msg_info("%s: milter %s", myname, milter->m.name);
2660
2661 /*
2662 * The next read on this Milter socket happens in a different process. It
2663 * will not automatically flush the output buffer in this process.
2664 */
2665 if (milter->fp)
2666 vstream_fflush(milter->fp);
2667
2668 if (attr_print(stream, ATTR_FLAG_MORE,
2669 SEND_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_MILT_NAME, milter->m.name),
2670 SEND_ATTR_INT(MAIL_ATTR_MILT_VERS, milter->version),
2671 SEND_ATTR_INT(MAIL_ATTR_MILT_ACTS, milter->rq_mask),
2672 SEND_ATTR_INT(MAIL_ATTR_MILT_EVTS, milter->ev_mask),
2673 SEND_ATTR_INT(MAIL_ATTR_MILT_NPTS, milter->np_mask),
2674 SEND_ATTR_INT(MAIL_ATTR_MILT_STAT, milter->state),
2675 SEND_ATTR_INT(MAIL_ATTR_MILT_CONN, milter->conn_timeout),
2676 SEND_ATTR_INT(MAIL_ATTR_MILT_CMD, milter->cmd_timeout),
2677 SEND_ATTR_INT(MAIL_ATTR_MILT_MSG, milter->msg_timeout),
2678 SEND_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_MILT_ACT, milter->def_action),
2679 SEND_ATTR_INT(MAIL_ATTR_MILT_MAC, milter->m.macros != 0),
2680 ATTR_TYPE_END) != 0
2681 || (milter->m.macros != 0
2682 && attr_print(stream, ATTR_FLAG_NONE,
2683 SEND_ATTR_FUNC(milter_macros_print,
2684 (void *) milter->m.macros),
2685 ATTR_TYPE_END) != 0)
2686 || (milter->m.macros == 0
2687 && attr_print(stream, ATTR_FLAG_NONE,
2688 ATTR_TYPE_END) != 0)
2689 || vstream_fflush(stream) != 0) {
2690 return (-1);
2691#ifdef CANT_WRITE_BEFORE_SENDING_FD
2692 } else if (attr_scan(stream, ATTR_FLAG_STRICT,
2693 RECV_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_DUMMY, milter->buf),
2694 ATTR_TYPE_END) != 1) {
2695 return (-1);
2696#endif
2697 } else if (LOCAL_SEND_FD(vstream_fileno(stream),
2698 vstream_fileno(milter->fp)) < 0) {
2699 return (-1);
2700#ifdef MUST_READ_AFTER_SENDING_FD
2701 } else if (attr_scan(stream, ATTR_FLAG_STRICT,
2702 RECV_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_DUMMY, milter->buf),
2703 ATTR_TYPE_END) != 1) {
2704 return (-1);
2705#endif
2706 } else {
2707 return (0);
2708 }
2709}
2710
2711static MILTER8 *milter8_alloc(const char *, int, int, int, const char *,
2712 const char *, MILTERS *);
2713
2714/* milter8_receive - receive milter instance */
2715
2716MILTER *milter8_receive(VSTREAM *stream, MILTERS *parent)
2717{
2718 const char *myname = "milter8_receive";
2719 static VSTRING *name_buf;
2720 static VSTRING *act_buf;
2721 MILTER8 *milter;
2722 int version;
2723 int rq_mask;
2724 int ev_mask;
2725 int np_mask;
2726 int state;
2727 int conn_timeout;
2728 int cmd_timeout;
2729 int msg_timeout;
2730 int fd;
2731 int has_macros;
2732 MILTER_MACROS *macros = 0;
2733
2734#define FREE_MACROS_AND_RETURN(x) do { \
2735 if (macros) \
2736 milter_macros_free(macros); \
2737 return (x); \
2738 } while (0)
2739
2740 if (name_buf == 0) {
2741 name_buf = vstring_alloc(10);
2742 act_buf = vstring_alloc(10);
2743 }
2744 if (attr_scan(stream, ATTR_FLAG_STRICT | ATTR_FLAG_MORE,
2745 RECV_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_MILT_NAME, name_buf),
2746 RECV_ATTR_INT(MAIL_ATTR_MILT_VERS, &version),
2747 RECV_ATTR_INT(MAIL_ATTR_MILT_ACTS, &rq_mask),
2748 RECV_ATTR_INT(MAIL_ATTR_MILT_EVTS, &ev_mask),
2749 RECV_ATTR_INT(MAIL_ATTR_MILT_NPTS, &np_mask),
2750 RECV_ATTR_INT(MAIL_ATTR_MILT_STAT, &state),
2751 RECV_ATTR_INT(MAIL_ATTR_MILT_CONN, &conn_timeout),
2752 RECV_ATTR_INT(MAIL_ATTR_MILT_CMD, &cmd_timeout),
2753 RECV_ATTR_INT(MAIL_ATTR_MILT_MSG, &msg_timeout),
2754 RECV_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_MILT_ACT, act_buf),
2755 RECV_ATTR_INT(MAIL_ATTR_MILT_MAC, &has_macros),
2756 ATTR_TYPE_END) < 10
2757 || (has_macros != 0
2758 && attr_scan(stream, ATTR_FLAG_STRICT,
2759 RECV_ATTR_FUNC(milter_macros_scan,
2760 (void *) (macros =
2761 milter_macros_alloc(MILTER_MACROS_ALLOC_ZERO))),
2762 ATTR_TYPE_END) < 1)
2763 || (has_macros == 0
2764 && attr_scan(stream, ATTR_FLAG_STRICT,
2765 ATTR_TYPE_END) < 0)) {
2766 FREE_MACROS_AND_RETURN(0);
2767#ifdef CANT_WRITE_BEFORE_SENDING_FD
2768 } else if (attr_print(stream, ATTR_FLAG_NONE,
2769 SEND_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_DUMMY, ""),
2770 ATTR_TYPE_END) != 0
2771 || vstream_fflush(stream) != 0) {
2772 FREE_MACROS_AND_RETURN(0);
2773#endif
2774 } else if ((fd = LOCAL_RECV_FD(vstream_fileno(stream))) < 0) {
2775 FREE_MACROS_AND_RETURN(0);
2776 } else {
2777#ifdef MUST_READ_AFTER_SENDING_FD
2778 (void) attr_print(stream, ATTR_FLAG_NONE,
2779 SEND_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_DUMMY, ""),
2780 ATTR_TYPE_END);
2781#endif
2782#define NO_PROTOCOL ((char *) 0)
2783
2784 if (msg_verbose)
2785 msg_info("%s: milter %s", myname, STR(name_buf));
2786
2787 milter = milter8_alloc(STR(name_buf), conn_timeout, cmd_timeout,
2788 msg_timeout, NO_PROTOCOL, STR(act_buf), parent);
2789 milter->fp = vstream_fdopen(fd, O_RDWR);
2790 milter->m.macros = macros;
2791 vstream_control(milter->fp, CA_VSTREAM_CTL_DOUBLE, CA_VSTREAM_CTL_END);
2792 /* Avoid poor performance when TCP MSS > VSTREAM_BUFSIZE. */
2793 vstream_tweak_sock(milter->fp);
2794 milter->version = version;
2795 milter->rq_mask = rq_mask;
2796 milter->ev_mask = ev_mask;
2797 milter->np_mask = np_mask;
2798 milter->state = state;
2799 return (&milter->m);
2800 }
2801}
2802
2803/* milter8_free - destroy Milter instance */
2804
2805static void milter8_free(MILTER *m)
2806{
2807 MILTER8 *milter = (MILTER8 *) m;
2808
2809 if (msg_verbose)
2810 msg_info("free milter %s", milter->m.name);
2811 if (milter->fp)
2812 (void) vstream_fclose(milter->fp);
2813 myfree(milter->m.name);
2814 vstring_free(milter->buf);
2815 vstring_free(milter->body);
2816 if (milter->protocol)
2817 myfree(milter->protocol);
2818 myfree(milter->def_action);
2819 if (milter->def_reply)
2820 myfree(milter->def_reply);
2821 if (milter->m.macros)
2822 milter_macros_free(milter->m.macros);
2823 myfree((void *) milter);
2824}
2825
2826/* milter8_alloc - create MTA-side Sendmail 8 Milter instance */
2827
2828static MILTER8 *milter8_alloc(const char *name, int conn_timeout,
2829 int cmd_timeout, int msg_timeout,
2830 const char *protocol,
2831 const char *def_action,
2832 MILTERS *parent)
2833{
2834 MILTER8 *milter;
2835
2836 /*
2837 * Fill in the structure. Note: all strings must be copied.
2838 */
2839 milter = (MILTER8 *) mymalloc(sizeof(*milter));
2840 milter->m.name = mystrdup(name);
2841 milter->m.flags = 0;
2842 milter->m.next = 0;
2843 milter->m.parent = parent;
2844 milter->m.macros = 0;
2845 milter->m.conn_event = milter8_conn_event;
2846 milter->m.helo_event = milter8_helo_event;
2847 milter->m.mail_event = milter8_mail_event;
2848 milter->m.rcpt_event = milter8_rcpt_event;
2849 milter->m.data_event = milter8_data_event; /* may be null */
2850 milter->m.message = milter8_message;
2851 milter->m.unknown_event = milter8_unknown_event; /* may be null */
2852 milter->m.other_event = milter8_other_event;
2853 milter->m.abort = milter8_abort;
2854 milter->m.disc_event = milter8_disc_event;
2855 milter->m.active = milter8_active;
2856 milter->m.send = milter8_send;
2857 milter->m.free = milter8_free;
2858 milter->fp = 0;
2859 milter->buf = vstring_alloc(100);
2860 milter->body = vstring_alloc(100);
2861 milter->version = 0;
2862 milter->rq_mask = 0;
2863 milter->ev_mask = 0;
2864 milter->state = MILTER8_STAT_CLOSED;
2865 milter->conn_timeout = conn_timeout;
2866 milter->cmd_timeout = cmd_timeout;
2867 milter->msg_timeout = msg_timeout;
2868 milter->protocol = (protocol ? mystrdup(protocol) : 0);
2869 milter->def_action = mystrdup(def_action);
2870 milter->def_reply = 0;
2871 milter->skip_event_type = 0;
2872
2873 return (milter);
2874}
2875
2876/* milter8_create - create MTA-side Sendmail 8 Milter instance */
2877
2878MILTER *milter8_create(const char *name, int conn_timeout, int cmd_timeout,
2879 int msg_timeout, const char *protocol,
2880 const char *def_action, MILTERS *parent)
2881{
2882 MILTER8 *milter;
2883
2884 /*
2885 * Fill in the structure.
2886 */
2887 milter = milter8_alloc(name, conn_timeout, cmd_timeout, msg_timeout,
2888 protocol, def_action, parent);
2889
2890 /*
2891 * XXX Sendmail 8 libmilter closes the MTA-to-filter socket when it finds
2892 * out that the SMTP client has disconnected. Because of this, Postfix
2893 * has to open a new MTA-to-filter socket for each SMTP client.
2894 */
2895#ifndef LIBMILTER_AUTO_DISCONNECT
2896 milter8_connect(milter);
2897#endif
2898 return (&milter->m);
2899}
